  4411                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4412                                  
  4413                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4414                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4415                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4416                                  
  4417                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4418                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4419                                  		;=============================================================
  4420                                  		;
  4421                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4422                                  		;
  4423                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4424                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4425                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4426                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4427                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4428                                  
  4429                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4430                                  		;=============================================================
  4431                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4432                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4433                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4434                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4435                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4436                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4437                                  		
  4438 00001772 FA                      		cli
  4439                                  
  4440                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4441                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4442                                  		;push	ax
  4443                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4444                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4445                                  		;pop	ax
  4446                                  	
  4447                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4448                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4449                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4450                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4451                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4452                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4453                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4454                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4455                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4456                                  
  4457                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4458                                  
  4459                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4460                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4461                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4462                                  
  4463 00001773 2EA3[CE16]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4464 00001777 2E891E[CC16]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4465                                  
  4466                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4467                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4468                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4469                                  
  4470 0000177C 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4471 0000177D 07                      		pop	es
  4472 0000177E 51                      		push	cx
  4473 0000177F 57                      		push	di
  4474                                  
  4475                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4476                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4477                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4478                                  		; ds = cs
  4479 00001780 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4480 00001782 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4481                                  		; ds = 0
  4482                                  
  4483 00001784 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4484                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4485                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4486                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4487 00001786 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4488                                  next_int_:		
  4489 00001789 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4490 0000178A AC                      		lodsb		
  4491                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4492 0000178B 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4493 0000178C D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4494 0000178E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4495 00001790 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4496 00001792 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4497                                  					; saving address in di
  4498 00001794 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4499 00001795 AB                      		stosw
  4500 00001796 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4501 00001797 AB                      		stosw			; save the vector
  4502 00001798 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4503 0000179A E2ED                    		loop	next_int_
  4504 0000179C 5F                      		pop	di
  4505 0000179D 59                      		pop	cx
  4506                                  
  4507                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4508                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4509                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4510                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4511                                  
  4512                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4513                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4514                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4515                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4516                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4517                                  
  4518                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4519 0000179E C7064C00[7407]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4520                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4521                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4522 000017A4 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4523                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4524 000017A8 C7065400[4808]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4525                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4526                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4527 000017AE 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4528                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4529 000017B2 C7066400[F907]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4530                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4531                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4532 000017B8 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4533                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4534                                  
  4535                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4536 000017BC 0E                      		push	cs
  4537 000017BD 1F                      		pop	ds
  4538                                  		
  4539 000017BE A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4540 000017C1 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4541 000017C4 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4542 000017C7 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4543                                  					; ;
  4544 000017CA FB                      		sti
  4545 000017CB CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4546                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4547                                  
  4548                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4549                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4550                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4551                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4552                                  ;
  4553                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4554                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4555                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4556                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4557                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4558                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4559                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4560                                  
  4561                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4562                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4563                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4564                                  ;
  4565                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4566                                  ; to do anything special.
  4567                                  ;
  4568                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4569                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4570                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4571                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4572                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4573                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4574                                  
  4575                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4576 000017CD A801                    		test	al, 1
  4577                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4578 000017CF 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4579                                  
  4580                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4581                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4582                                  ;
  4583                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4584                                  ;
  4585                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4586                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4587                                  
  4588 000017D1 50                      		push	ax
  4589 000017D2 53                      		push	bx
  4590 000017D3 51                      		push	cx
  4591 000017D4 52                      		push	dx
  4592 000017D5 57                      		push	di
  4593 000017D6 06                      		push	es
  4594 000017D7 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4595 000017D9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4596 000017DB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4597                                  					; DL = drive number
  4598                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4599                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4600                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4601 000017DD 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4602                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4603                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4604                                  		; ds = cs
  4605 000017DF 8816[7117]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4606                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4607 000017E3 07                      		pop	es
  4608 000017E4 5F                      		pop	di
  4609 000017E5 5A                      		pop	dx
  4610 000017E6 59                      		pop	cx
  4611 000017E7 5B                      		pop	bx
  4612 000017E8 58                      		pop	ax
  4613 000017E9 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4614                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4615                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4616                                  
  4617                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4618                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4619                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4620                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4621 000017EB A0[7117]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4622 000017EE 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4623 000017F0 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4624                                  
  4625                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4626                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4627 000017F2 48                      		dec	ax
  4628 000017F3 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs

  4630                                  
  4631                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4632                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4633 000017F5 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4634 000017F8 A2[E116]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4635                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4636                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4637                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4638 000017FB EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4639                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4640                                  
  4641                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4642 000017FD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4643 000017FF D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4644                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4645                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4646                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4647 00001801 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4648 00001803 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4649 00001805 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4650                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4651                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4652                                  		; ds = cs
  4653 00001806 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]

  4658                                  					; booted off hard file
  4659 0000180B 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4660                                  
  4661                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4662                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4663                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here

  4720                                  					; AKPORT

  4722                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications
  4723                                  ; chip installed at io address 50h and 52h. if we're running

  4736 0000185B E650                    		out	50h, al

  5024                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5025                                  ; diskette drives:
  5026                                  ;
  5027                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5028                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5029                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5030                                  ;
  5031                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5032                                  ;
  5033                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5034                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5035                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5036                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5037                                  					
  5038 0000198F 30D2                    		xor	dl, dl

  5047                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5048                                  
  5049                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5050                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5051                                  
  5052                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5053                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5054                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5055                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5056                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5057                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5058                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5059                                  ; the bds for harddrives.

  5238                                  ; we need to do special things if we have a single drive system and are setting
  5239                                  ; up a logical drive. it needs to have the same int13 drive number as its
  5240                                  ; counterpart, but the next drive letter. also reset ownership flag.
  5241                                  ; we detect the presence of this situation by examining the flag single for the

  5249                                  ; the values that we put in for BDS_RBPB.BPB_HEADS and
  5250                                  ; BDS_RBPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK will only remain if the

  5359                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5360                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5361                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5362                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk

  5376                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5377                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table

  5379                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5380                                  ;
  5381                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5382                                  ;
  5383                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5384                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5385                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5386                                  ;use to start with.
  5387                                  ;
  5388                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5389                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5390                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5391                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5392                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5393

  5465                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5466                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5467                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5468                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5469                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5470                                  ; off of it.

  5472                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5473                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5474                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5475                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide

  5660

  5673

  5680

  5684                                  	;	mov	[cs:md_sectorsize], bx	; used by get_fat_sector proc.

  5691                                  	;	;sub	es:16D8h, ax

  5693                                  	;				; need a logical sector number that will

  5702 00001C23 891E[D816]              		mov	[md_sectorsize], bx ; used by get_fat_sector proc.

  5708 00001C37 2906[CC16]              		sub	[bios_l], ax	; subtract hidden sectors since we
  5709                                  					; need a logical sector number that will
  5710                                  					; be used by getclus(diskrd procedure)

  5713                                  	; ------

  5716

  5751                                  		;jmp	far 46Dh:267h

  5755                                  
  5756                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5757                                  ;
  5758                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5759                                  
  5760                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5761                                  
  5762                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5763                                  ; module name: remap
  5764                                  ;
  5765                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5766                                  ;
  5767                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5768                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5769                                  ;
  5770                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5771                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5772                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5773                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5774                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5775                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5776                                  
  5777                                  ; input:       none
  5778                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5779                                  ; exit error:  none
  5780                                  ; called from: msinit
  5781                                  ;
  5782                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5783                                  ;	  found in the system
  5784                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5785                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5786                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5787                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5788                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5789                                  ;
  5790                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5791                                  
  5792                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5793                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5794                                  
  5795                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5796 00001C77 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5797                                  
  5798                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5799                                  
  5800                                  drive_loop:				
  5801 00001C7C 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5802                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5803 00001C80 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5804 00001C82 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5805                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5806 00001C84 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  5807 00001C87 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5808 00001C89 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5809                                  
  5810                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5811                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5812                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5813                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5814                                  
  5815                                  fdrv_found:				
  5816 00001C8B B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5817                                  fdrv_loop:				
  5818 00001C8D 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5819                                  					; found	??
  5820 00001C90 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5821                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  5822                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  5823                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5824 00001C92 40                      		inc	ax
  5825 00001C93 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  5826 00001C96 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  5827                                  
  5828                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5829                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  5830                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  5831                                  ; any more.
  5832                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5833                                  
  5834 00001C98 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  5835                                  					; get first bds
  5836 00001C9D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5837                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  5838 00001C9F 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  5839 00001CA4 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  5840                                  remap_loop1:				
  5841 00001CA7 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5842                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  5843 00001CA9 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5844 00001CAC FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  5845 00001CAE FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  5846 00001CB0 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  5847                                  
  5848                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  5849                                  
  5850 00001CB2 2EA0[CA16]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  5851 00001CB6 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  5852 00001CB8 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  5853 00001CBA 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  5854 00001CBF 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  5855                                  
  5856                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  5857                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  5858                                  
  5859 00001CC1 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  5860 00001CC3 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  5861                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5862                                  
  5863                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  5864                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  5865                                  
  5866                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  5867 00001CC5 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  5868                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  5869 00001CCA 2EA2[CA16]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  5870 00001CCE FEC0                    		inc	al
  5871 00001CD0 1E                      		push	ds
  5872 00001CD1 BF5304                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  5873                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  5874 00001CD4 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  5875 00001CD6 A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  5876                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  5877                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  5878 00001CD9 1F                      		pop	ds
  5879                                  rmap_exit:				
  5880 00001CDA C3                      		retn
  5881                                  
  5882                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5883                                  
  5884                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5885                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  5886                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  5887                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  5888                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  5889                                  ;**************************************************
  5890                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  5891                                  ;
  5892                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  5893                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  5894                                  ;
  5895                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  5896                                  ;**************************************************
  5897                                  
  5898                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5899                                  bootbias equ 200h
  5900                                  
  5901                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  5902                                  		
  5903                                  		; 08/04/2018
  5904                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  5905                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  5906                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5907                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  5908                                  
  5909 00001CDB 2EA1[D516]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  5910 00001CDF 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  5911                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5912 00001CE1 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  5913                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  5914                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  5915 00001CE4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  5916 00001CE7 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  5917 00001CE9 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  5918 00001CEC CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  5919                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  5920                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  5921                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  5922 00001CEE 7209                    		jb	short erret
  5923                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5924 00001CF0 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  5925                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  5926                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  5927 00001CF7 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  5928                                  erret:					
  5929 00001CF9 F9                      		stc
  5930                                  norm_ret:				
  5931 00001CFA C3                      		retn
  5932                                  
  5933                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5934                                  
  5935                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  5936                                  
  5937                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5938                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  5939                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  5940                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  5941                                  ;   determine version number
  5942                                  ;
  5943                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  5944                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  5945                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  5946                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  5947                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  5948                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  5949                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  5950                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5951                                  
  5952                                  sethard:	; proc near		
  5953                                  		; 14/08/2023
  5954                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  5955 00001CFB 57                      		push	di
  5956 00001CFC 53                      		push	bx
  5957                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 14/08/2023
  5958 00001CFD 06                      		push	es
  5959 00001CFE 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5960 00001D01 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5961 00001D04 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  5962                                  					; fnon_removable
  5963 00001D08 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  5964                                  					; ffHardFile
  5965 00001D0C C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  5966 00001D11 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  5967 00001D13 52                      		push	dx
  5968 00001D14 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  5969 00001D16 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5970                                  					; DL = drive number
  5971                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5972                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  5973                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  5974 00001D18 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  5975 00001D1A 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  5976 00001D1D 5A                      		pop	dx
  5977 00001D1E 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  5978 00001D20 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  5979 00001D23 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  5980 00001D26 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  5981 00001D27 E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  5982 00001D2A 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  5983 00001D2B 7256                    		jb	short setret
  5984 00001D2D BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  5985                                  
  5986                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  5987                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  5988                                  
  5989                                  act_part:				
  5990 00001D30 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  5991 00001D35 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  5992 00001D37 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  5993 00001D3B 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  5994 00001D3D 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  5995 00001D41 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  5996 00001D43 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  5997 00001D47 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  5998                                  got_good_act:				
  5999 00001D49 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6000 00001D4B 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6001 00001D4D FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6002                                  no_act:					
  6003 00001D4F 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6004 00001D52 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6005                                  					; last entry done?
  6006 00001D56 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6007 00001D58 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6008                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6009                                  
  6010                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6011                                  
  6012                                  get_primary:				
  6013 00001D5B 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6014 00001D60 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6015                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6016 00001D62 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6017 00001D66 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6018 00001D68 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6019 00001D6C 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6020 00001D6E 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6021 00001D72 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6022                                  got_prim:				
  6023 00001D74 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6024 00001D76 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6025 00001D78 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6026                                  not_prim:				
  6027 00001D7A 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6028 00001D7D 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6029 00001D81 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6030                                  setret:					
  6031 00001D83 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6032 00001D84 E9A102                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6033                                  
  6034                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6035                                  
  6036                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6037                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6038                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6039                                  ;
  6040                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6041                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6042                                  ;  without change.
  6043                                  ;
  6044                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6045                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6046                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6047                                  
  6048                                  set2:					
  6049                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6050                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)

  6708                                  dobig:

  6710 00001FD9 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)

  6712 00001FDD D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  6713 00001FDF 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx

  6716 00001FE5 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1

  6721                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  6722                                  
  6723                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  6724                                  
  6725                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  6726                                  		; 27/09/2022
  6727                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  6728                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  6729                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  6730                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  6731                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6732                                  		; (If FATType == FAT16,	BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz))
  6733                                  		
  6734                                  					; dx:ax = TmpVal1, bx = TmpVal2
  6735 00001FF0 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; 
  6736 00001FF2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2
  6737 00001FF5 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		
  6738 00001FF8 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2-1
  6739                                  
  6740                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  6741                                  
  6742 00001FFB F7F3                    		div	bx		; BDS.fatsecs =
  6743                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  6744 00001FFD 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6745                                  					; number of fat	sectors

  6755                                  		;mov	[di+1Fh], bl	; [di+BDS.fatsiz] ; fat	size flag

  6778                                  ; set according to the partition information. we are going to
  6779                                  ; see if (hidden sectors + total sectors) > a word. if it is true,
  6780                                  ; then no change. otherwise, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be moved
  6781                                  ; to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be set to 0.
  6782                                  ; we don't do this for the bpb information from the boot record. we
  6783                                  ; are not going to change the bpb information from the boot record.

  6837                                  ;instead, sometimes fdisk use 10000h to calculate the maximum number.

  6898                                  ; setdrvparms sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the system based on
  6899                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  6900                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same
  6901                                  ; as the bpb on the drive.

  7082                                  ; 15/10/2022 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7083                                  ; 30/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7084                                  ; 03/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7085                                  ; (19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0)
  7086                                  
  7087                                  ; domini **********************************************************************
  7088                                  ;
  7089                                  ;mini disk initialization routine. called right after dohard
  7090                                  ;modified for >2 hardfile support
  7091                                  ;
  7092                                  ; **cs=ds=es=datagrp
  7093                                  ;
  7094                                  ; **domini will search for every extended partition in the system, and
  7095                                  ;   initialize it.
  7096                                  ;
  7097                                  ; **bdsm stands for bds table for mini disk and located right after the label
  7098                                  ;   end96tpi. end_of_bdsm will have the offset value of the ending
  7099                                  ;   address of bdsm table.
  7100                                  ;
  7101                                  ; **bdsm is the same as usual bds structure except that tim_lo, tim_hi entries
  7102                                  ;   are overlapped and used to identify mini disk and the number of hidden_trks.
  7103                                  ;   right now, they are called as ismini, hidden_trks respectively.
  7104                                  ;
  7105                                  ; **domini will use the same routine in sethard routine after label set2 to
  7106                                  ;   save coding.
  7107                                  ;
  7108                                  ; **drvmax determined in dohard routine will be used for the next
  7109                                  ;   available logical mini disk drive number.
  7110                                  ;
  7111                                  ; input: drvmax, dskdrvs
  7112                                  ;
  7113                                  ; output: minidisk installed. bdsm table established and installed to bds.
  7114                                  ;	  end_of_bdsm - ending offset address of bdsm.
  7115                                  ;
  7116                                  ; called modules:
  7117                                  ;		  getboot
  7118                                  ;		  find_mini_partition (new), xinstall_bds (new), M038
  7119                                  ;
  7120                                  ;		  setmini (new, it will use set2 routine)
  7121                                  ;
  7122                                  ; variables used: end_of_bdsm
  7123                                  ;		  rom_minidisk_num
  7124                                  ;		  mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  7125                                  ;		  BDS_STRUC, start_bds
  7126                                  ;
  7127                                  ;******************************************************************************
  7128                                  
  7129                                  		; 19/10/2022
  7130                                  domini:	
  7131 00002131 8A36[5117]              		mov	dh, [hnum]	; get number of hardfiles
  7132                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7133 00002135 20F6                    		and	dh, dh
  7134                                  		;cmp	dh, 0
  7135 00002137 7431                    		jz	short dominiret	; no hard file?	then exit.
  7136 00002139 B280                    		mov	dl, 80h		; start	with hardfile 80h
  7137                                  domini_loop:				
  7138 0000213B 52                      		push	dx
  7139 0000213C 8816[5017]              		mov	[rom_minidisk_num], dl
  7140 00002140 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  7141 00002142 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7142                                  					; DL = drive number
  7143                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  7144                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  7145                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  7146 00002144 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  7147 00002146 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  7148 00002148 88F0                    		mov	al, dh
  7149 0000214A A3[5617]                		mov	[mini_hdlim], ax ; # of heads
  7150 0000214D 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  7151 00002150 88C8                    		mov	al, cl
  7152 00002152 A3[5817]                		mov	[mini_seclim], ax ; # of sectors/track
  7153 00002155 06                      		push	es
  7154 00002156 8A16[5017]              		mov	dl, [rom_minidisk_num]
  7155 0000215A E87EFB                  		call	getboot		; read master boot record into
  7156                                  					; initbootsegment:bootbias
  7157 0000215D 7203                    		jb	short domininext
  7158 0000215F E80900                  		call	find_mini_partition
  7159                                  domininext:				
  7160 00002162 07                      		pop	es
  7161 00002163 5A                      		pop	dx
  7162 00002164 FEC2                    		inc	dl		; next hard file
  7163 00002166 FECE                    		dec	dh
  7164 00002168 75D1                    		jnz	short domini_loop
  7165                                  dominiret:				
  7166 0000216A C3                      		retn
  7167                                  
  7168                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7169                                  
  7170                                  ; 15/10/2022 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7171                                  ; 30/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7172                                  
  7173                                  ;find_mini_partition tries to find every extended partition on a disk.
  7174                                  ;at entry:	di -> bdsm entry
  7175                                  ;		es:bx -> 07c0:bootbias - master boot record
  7176                                  ;		rom_minidisk_num - rom drive number
  7177                                  ;		drvmax - logical drive number
  7178                                  ;		mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  7179                                  ;
  7180                                  ;called routine: setmini which uses set2 (in sethard routine)
  7181                                  ;variables & equates used from original bios - flags, fnon_removable, fbigfat
  7182                                  
  7183                                  
  7184                                  find_mini_partition:	
  7185 0000216B 81C3C201                		add	bx, 1C2h	; bx ->	file system id
  7186                                  fmpnext:				
  7187 0000216F 26803F05                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 5 ; 5 = extended partition id.
  7188 00002173 740A                    		jz	short fmpgot
  7189 00002175 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  7190 00002178 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  7191 0000217C 75F1                    		jnz	short fmpnext
  7192                                  		;jmp	short fmpnextfound ; extended partition	not found
  7193                                  		; 18/12/2022
  7194                                  fmpnextfound:
  7195 0000217E C3                      		retn
  7196                                  
  7197                                  ;		; 30/07/2019 - Retro DOS v3.2
  7198                                  ;		jb	short fmpnext
  7199                                  ;fmpret:
  7200                                  ;		retn	; 29/05/2019
  7201                                  
  7202                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7203                                  
  7204                                  		; 19/10/2022
  7205                                  fmpgot:					; found my partition.				
  7206 0000217F E89D00                  		call	dmax_check	; check	for drvmax already 26
  7207 00002182 73FA                    		jnb	short fmpnextfound ; done if too many
  7208 00002184 8B3E[5417]              		mov	di, [end_of_bdss] ; get next free	bds
  7209 00002188 C745470100              		mov	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  7210                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7211 0000218D 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1
  7212                                  		;or	word [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  7213                                  					; fNon_Removable
  7214 00002191 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  7215                                  					; ffHardFile
  7216 00002195 C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit fat.
  7217 0000219A A1[5617]                		mov	ax, [mini_hdlim]
  7218 0000219D 894515                  		mov	[di+15h], ax	; [di+BDS.heads]
  7219 000021A0 A1[5817]                		mov	ax, [mini_seclim]
  7220 000021A3 894513                  		mov	[di+13h], ax	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  7221 000021A6 A0[5017]                		mov	al, [rom_minidisk_num]
  7222 000021A9 884504                  		mov	[di+4],	al	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  7223                                  					; set physical number
  7224 000021AC A0[7500]                		mov	al, [drvmax]
  7225 000021AF 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  7226                                  					; set logical number
  7227 000021B2 26837F0A00              		cmp	word [es:bx+10], 0
  7228 000021B7 7707                    		ja	short fmpgot_cont
  7229 000021B9 26837F0840              		cmp	word [es:bx+8], 64 ; with current bpb,
  7230                                  					; only lower word is meaningful.
  7231 000021BE 72BE                    		jb	short fmpnextfound
  7232                                  					; should be bigger than 64 sectors at least
  7233                                  fmpgot_cont:				
  7234 000021C0 83EB04                  		sub	bx, 4		; let bx point to the start of the entry
  7235 000021C3 268A7702                		mov	dh, [es:bx+2]	; cylinder
  7236 000021C7 80E6C0                  		and	dh, 0C0h	; get higher bits of cyl
  7237 000021CA D0C6                    		rol	dh, 1
  7238 000021CC D0C6                    		rol	dh, 1
  7239 000021CE 268A5703                		mov	dl, [es:bx+3]	; cyl byte
  7240 000021D2 895549                  		mov	[di+49h], dx	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  7241                                  					; set hidden trks
  7242 000021D5 268B4F02                		mov	cx, [es:bx+2]	; cylinder,cylinder/sector
  7243 000021D9 268A7701                		mov	dh, [es:bx+1]	; head
  7244 000021DD 8A16[5017]              		mov	dl, [rom_minidisk_num]
  7245 000021E1 BB0002                  		mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  7246 000021E4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  7247 000021E7 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  7248                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  7249                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  7250                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  7251 000021E9 7293                    		jb	short fmpnextfound
  7252 000021EB BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  7253                                  
  7254                                  		; 14/08/2023
  7255                                  		;push	es
  7256 000021EE E80800                  		call	setmini		; install a mini disk.
  7257                                  					; bx value saved.
  7258                                  		;pop	es  ; 14/08/2023
  7259 000021F1 7203                    		jb	short fmpnextchain
  7260 000021F3 E83E00                  		call	xinstall_bds	; -- install the bdsm into table
  7261                                  fmpnextchain:				
  7262 000021F6 E976FF                  		jmp	fmpnext		; let's find out
  7263                                  					; if we	have any chained partition
  7264                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7265                                  
  7266                                  		; 18/12/2022
  7267                                  ;fmpnextfound:				
  7268                                  		;retn

  7275                                  setmini:	; 'setmini' is called from 'find_mini_partition' procedure
  7276                                  	
  7277 000021F9 57                      		push	di
  7278 000021FA 53                      		push	bx
  7279                                  		; 14/08/2023
  7280                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment
  7281                                  		;push	ds
  7282 000021FB 06                      		push	es
  7283                                  setmini_1:

  7285 00002200 741A                    		jz	short setmini_2
  7286 00002202 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4 ; FAT16 partition
  7287 00002206 7414                    		jz	short setmini_2
  7288 00002208 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6 ; FAT16 BIG	partition
  7289 0000220C 740E                    		jz	short setmini_2

  7291 00002211 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  7292 00002215 75E5                    		jnz	short setmini_1

  7295                                  		; 14/08/2023

  7310                                  ; dmax_check --- call this when we want to install a new drive.
  7311                                  ;		it checks for drvmax < 26 to see if there is
  7312                                  ;		a drive letter left.

  7315                                  ;	drvmax >=26 : carry RESET!, error flag set for message later
  7316                                  ;			trash ax

  7320 00002224 720D                    		jb	short dmax_ok	; return with carry if okay
  7321 00002226 06                      		push	es
  7322                                  		;mov	ax, 46Dh	; SYSINIT_SEG (SYSINIT segment)
  7323 00002227 B85304                  		mov	ax, SYSINITSEG	; 17/10/2022

  7337                                  		;;pop	es

  7345                                  ; 18/10/2022
  7346                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7347                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0						
  7348                                  ;								 
  7349                                  ;	link next bds (at ds:di) into the chain. assume that the
  7350                                  ;	  chain is entirely within ds == datagrp. also update drvmax,
  7351                                  ;	  dskdrv_table, and end_of_bdss.	
  7352                                  
  7353                                  xinstall_bds:		
  7354 00002234 56                      		push	si
  7355 00002235 53                      		push	bx
  7356 00002236 8B36[1901]              		mov	si, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  7357                                  xinstall_bds_1:

  7359 0000223D 7404                    		jz	short xinstall_bds_2 ;	skip ahead if so
  7360                                  		;mov	si, [si+BDS.link]
  7361 0000223F 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; chain	through	list
  7362 00002241 EBF7                    		jmp	short xinstall_bds_1
  7363                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7364                                  
  7365                                  xinstall_bds_2:				
  7366                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link], di
  7367 00002243 893C                    		mov	[si], di

  7369 00002245 8C5C02                  		mov	[si+2], ds
  7370                                  		;mov	word [di+BDS.link], -1
  7371 00002248 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; make sure it is a null ptr.
  7372                                  		;mov	[di+BDS.link+2], ds
  7373 0000224C 8C5D02                  		mov	[di+2], ds ; might as well plug segment
  7374                                  		; 20/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7375                                  		;lea	bx, [di+BDS.BPB]
  7376 0000224F 8D5D06                  		lea	bx, [di+6]
  7377 00002252 8B36[5217]              		mov	si, [last_dskdrv_table]
  7378 00002256 891C                    		mov	[si], bx
  7379 00002258 8306[5217]02            		add	word [last_dskdrv_table], 2
  7380 0000225D FE06[7500]              		inc	byte [drvmax]
  7381 00002261 8306[5417]64            		add	word [end_of_bdss], 100 ; BDS.size = 100
  7382 00002266 5B                      		pop	bx
  7383 00002267 5E                      		pop	si
  7384 00002268 C3                      		retn

  7386                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7387                                  
  7388                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7389                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7390                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
