  9890                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9891                                  
  9892                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9893                                  
  9894                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9895                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9896                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9897                                  ;
  9898                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9899                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9900                                  
  9901                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9902                                  
  9903                                  readbootsec:	
  9904 000006AB B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9905 000006AD B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9906 000006B0 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9907 000006B3 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9908 000006B5 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9909                                  
  9910                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9911                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9912                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9913                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9914                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9915                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9916                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9917                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9918                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9919                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9920                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9921                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9922                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9923                                  		; informations
  9924                                  
  9925                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9926                                  
  9927                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9928 000006B7 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9929 000006BC 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9930 000006BE 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9931 000006C3 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9932 000006C5 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9933 000006CA 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9934 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9935 000006D1 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9936                                  
  9937                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9938                                  ;
  9939                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9940                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9941                                  ;;
  9942                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9943                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9944                                  ;;
  9945                                  ;;check_signature:
  9946                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9947                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9948                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9949                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9950                                  
  9951                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9952                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9953                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9954                                  
  9955                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9956                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
  9957 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9958                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9959 000006D6 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9960 000006D8 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9961 000006DA 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9962                                  
  9963                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9964                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9965                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9966                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9967                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9968                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9969                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9970                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9971                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9972                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9973                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9974                                  
  9975                                  checksinglesided:
  9976 000006DC A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9977 000006DF 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9978 000006E1 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9979 000006E3 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9980 000006E5 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9981 000006E7 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9982 000006ED 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9983 000006EF 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9984 000006F4 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9985                                  
  9986                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9987                                  
  9988                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9989 000006F6 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9990                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9991 000006FB EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9992                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9993                                  
  9994                                  invalidbootsec:				
  9995 000006FD 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
  9996                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9997                                  movbpb_ret:
  9998                                  gooddsk:				
  9999 000006FE F8                      		clc
 10000                                  err_ret:
 10001 000006FF C3                      		retn
 10002                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10003                                  
 10004                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10005                                  ;err_ret:				
 10006                                  		;retn

 10010                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10011                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10012                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10013                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10014                                  ;
 10015                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10016                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10017                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10018                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10019                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10020                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10021                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10022                                  
 10023                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10024                                  
 10025                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10026                                  movbpb:	
 10027 00000700 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10028                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10029                                  					; sectors per unit
 10030 00000704 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10031                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10032                                  					; number of directory entries
 10033 00000708 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10034                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10035                                  					; size of drive
 10036 0000070C 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10037                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10038                                  					; media	descriptor
 10039 00000710 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10040                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10041                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10042 00000713 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10043                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10044                                  					; sectors per track
 10045 00000717 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10046                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10047                                  					; number of heads
 10048 0000071B 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10049 00000720 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10050 00000722 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10051 00000725 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10052 00000727 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10053                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10054 0000072C 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10055 00000731 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10056 00000733 E8D411                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10057                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10058                                  		; cf = 0
 10059                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10060                                  		;clc
 10061 00000736 C3                      		retn
 10062                                  
 10063                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10064                                  
 10065                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10066                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10067                                  ;by es:di.
 10068                                  
 10069                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10070                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10071                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10072                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10073                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10074                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10075                                  
 10076                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10077                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10078 00000737 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10079                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10080                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10081 0000073C 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10082 0000073E 51                      		push	cx
 10083 0000073F 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10084                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10085 00000743 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10086 00000747 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10087                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10088 0000074B 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10089 0000074F 57                      		push	di
 10090 00000750 56                      		push	si
 10091 00000751 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10092 00000754 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10093                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10094                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10095 00000757 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10096 0000075A F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10097                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10098                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10099 0000075C B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10100 0000075E BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h

 10102 00000761 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL

 10115 0000076A F9                      		stc

 10118                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10119                                  
 10120                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10121                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10122                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10123                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10124                                  ; output:
 10125                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10126                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10127                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10128                                  
 10129                                  readfat:	
 10130                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10131                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10132 0000076C 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10133 0000076E B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10134                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10135 00000771 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10136 00000774 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10137 00000776 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10138                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10139 00000778 C3                      		retn
 10140                                  
 10141                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10142                                  
 10143                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10144                                  
 10145                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10146                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10147                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10148                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10149                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10150                                  ;		dh has head
 10151                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10152                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10153                                  ;
 10154                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10155                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10156                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10157                                  ;
 10158                                  ;		carry set
 10159                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10160                                  ;
 10161                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10162                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10163                                  
 10164                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10165                                  
 10166                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10167                                  read_sector:	
 10168 00000779 55                      		push	bp
 10169 0000077A BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10170 0000077D 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10171 00000781 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10172                                  rd_ret:					
 10173 00000784 06                      		push	es
 10174 00000785 1E                      		push	ds
 10175 00000786 07                      		pop	es
 10176 00000787 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10177 0000078A CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10178                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10179                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10180                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10181 0000078C 07                      		pop	es
 10182 0000078D 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10183                                  rd_rty:					
 10184 0000078F E87604                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10185 00000792 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret

 10339                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10340                                  
 10341                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10342                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10343                                  
 10344                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10345                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10346                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10347                                  
 10348                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10349                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10350                                  ;
 10351                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10352                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10353                                  
 10354                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10355                                  checksingle:		
 10356 0000083B 50                      		push	ax
 10357 0000083C 53                      		push	bx
 10358 0000083D 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10359                                  
 10360                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10361                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10362                                  
 10363 00000841 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10364 00000844 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10365 00000846 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10366                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10367 00000849 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10368                                  
 10369                                  
 10370                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10371                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10372                                  
 10373 0000084B 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10374                                  					; get physical drive number
 10375 0000084F 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10376 00000850 57                      		push	di
 10377 00000851 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10378                                  scan_list:				
 10379 00000855 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10380 00000859 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10381 0000085B B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10382 0000085D 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10383 00000861 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10384 00000863 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10385 00000867 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10386 00000868 07                      		pop	es
 10387 00000869 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10388                                  
 10389                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10390                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10391                                  ; in this case.
 10392 0000086D 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10393 00000872 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10394                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10395 00000874 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10396 00000879 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10397 0000087B 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10398                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10399                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10400 0000087F 06                      		push	es
 10401 00000880 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10402 00000884 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10403                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10404                                  					; set up sdsb
 10405 00000888 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10406 00000889 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10407                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10408                                  
 10409                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10410                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10411                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10412                                  
 10413                                  not_fsetowner:				
 10414 0000088B 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 10415 00000890 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10416 00000892 50                      		push	ax
 10417 00000893 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10418 00000897 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10419 00000899 06                      		push	es
 10420 0000089A 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10421 0000089E 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10422                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10423                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10424 000008A3 07                      		pop	es
 10425 000008A4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10426 000008A6 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10427 000008A7 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10428                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10429 000008A9 E8800E                  		call	swpdsk
 10430 000008AC EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10431                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10432                                  
 10433                                  scan_skip:	
 10434 000008AE 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]

 10436                                  					; go to	next bds
 10437 000008B1 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10438 000008B4 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10439 000008B6 F9                      		stc
 10440 000008B7 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10441 000008B8 07                      		pop	es
 10442                                  
 10443                                  singleret:

 10464                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10465                                  
 10466                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10467                                  
 10468                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10469                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10470                                  ;
 10471                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10472                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10473                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10474                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10475                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10476                                  ;	ds = cs
 10477                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10478                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10479                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10480                                  ;
 10481                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10482                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10483                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10484                                  
 10485                                  diskrd:	
 10486                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10487                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10488 000008C4 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10489                                  
 10490                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10491                                  
 10492                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10493                                  diskio:
 10494 000008C9 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10495 000008CB 8C06[3705]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10496 000008CF E8F9FB                  		call	SetDrive
 10497 000008D2 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10498 000008D6 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10499                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10500 000008D9 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10501                                  
 10502                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10503                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 10504                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 10505                                  
 10506 000008DB 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 10507                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10508                                  					; unformatted_media
 10509 000008E0 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 10510 000008E2 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 10511 000008E6 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 10512                                  
 10513                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 10514                                  
 10515 000008EA 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10516 000008EC 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 10517 000008EE 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 10518 000008F0 83D600                  		adc	si, 0
 10519 000008F3 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10520                                  					; > 32 bit sector ?
 10521 000008F8 740D                    		jz	short sanity32
 10522 000008FA 83FE00                  		cmp	si, 0
 10523 000008FD 75BD                    		jnz	short baddrive
 10524 000008FF 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10525 00000903 77B7                    		ja	short baddrive
 10526 00000905 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 10527                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10528                                  
 10529                                  sanity32:				
 10530 00000907 0336[2B05]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 10531 0000090B 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 10532 0000090F 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 10533 00000911 77A9                    		ja	short baddrive
 10534 00000913 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 10535 00000917 77A3                    		ja	short baddrive
 10536                                  
 10537                                  sanityok:				
 10538 00000919 8B16[2B05]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 10539 0000091D 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 10540 00000921 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 10541                                  
 10542                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 10543                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 10544                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 10545                                  
 10546 00000925 A3[2D05]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 10547                                  
 10548                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 10549                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 10550                                  
 10551 00000928 06                      		push	es
 10552 00000929 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10553 0000092D 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 10554                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 10555                                  					; current disk parm table
 10556 00000932 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 10557 00000936 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 10558 0000093A 07                      		pop	es
 10559 0000093B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10560                                  					; fnon_removable
 10561 00000940 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 10562 00000942 E8F6FE                  		call	checksingle
 10563                                  
 10564                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 10565                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 10566                                  ; the proper error code.
 10567                                  
 10568 00000945 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 10569 0000094A 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 10570 0000094C E8AB0E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 10571                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 10572                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 10573 0000094F E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 10574                                  
 10575                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code
 10576                                  
 10577                                  skip_setup:
 10578                                  
 10579                                  ; 32 bit sector calculation.
 10580                                  ; dx:[saved_word] = starting sector number.
 10581                                  				
 10582 00000952 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10583 00000954 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10584 00000956 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10585                                  					 ; divide by sec per track
 10586 0000095A A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10587 0000095D A1[2D05]                		mov	ax, [saved_word]
 10588 00000960 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10589                                  					; now, [temp_h]:ax = track #, dx = sector
 10590                                  		;inc	dl		; sector number	is 1 based.
 10591                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10592 00000964 42                      		inc	dx
 10593 00000965 8816[3101]              		mov	[cursec], dl	; save current sector
 10594 00000969 268B4D15                		mov	cx, [es:di+15h]	; es:di+BDS.heads]
 10595                                  					; get number of	heads
 10596 0000096D 50                      		push	ax
 10597 0000096E 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10598 00000970 A1[2905]                		mov	ax, [temp_h]	; divide tracks	by heads per cylinder
 10599 00000973 F7F1                    		div	cx
 10600 00000975 A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10601 00000978 58                      		pop	ax
 10602 00000979 F7F1                    		div	cx		; now, [temp_h]:ax = cylinder #, dx = head
 10603 0000097B 833E[2905]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
 10604 00000980 7714                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10605 00000982 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024	; 2^10 currently maxium	for track #.
 10606 00000985 770F                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10607 00000987 8816[3201]              		mov	[curhd], dl	; save current head
 10608 0000098B A3[3301]                		mov	[curtrk], ax	; save current track
 10609                                  
 10610                                  ; we are now set up for the i/o. normally, we consider the dma boundary
 10611                                  ; violations here. not true. we perform the operation as if everything is
 10612                                  ; symmetric; let the int 13 handler worry about the dma violations.
 10613                                  
 10614 0000098E A1[2201]                		mov	ax, [seccnt]
 10615 00000991 E88400                  		call	block		; (cas - call/ret)
 10616                                  		;call	done

 10839                                  ; if we have [step_drv] set to -1, we use the slow settle time.

 10936                                  ; check the error returned in ah to see if it is a soft ecc error.
 10937                                  ; if it is not we needn't do anything special. if it is a soft

 11062                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11063                                  
 11064                                  ; map error returned by rom in ah into corresponding code to be returned to
 11065                                  ; dos in al. trashes di. guaranteed to set carry.
 11066                                  
 11067                                  maperror:

 11069 00000BD1 06                      		push	es
 11070 00000BD2 1E                      		push	ds		; set es=Bios_Data
 11071 00000BD3 07                      		pop	es
 11072 00000BD4 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; put error code in al
 11073 00000BD6 A2[4401]                		mov	[lsterr], al	; terminate list with error code
 11074 00000BD9 B90900                  		mov	cx, 9		; numerr (= errout-errin)
 11075                                  					; number of possible error conditions
 11076 00000BDC BF[3C01]                		mov	di, errin	; point to error conditions
 11077 00000BDF F2AE                    		repne scasb
 11078                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11079 00000BE1 8A4508                  		mov	al, [di+8]	; [di+numerr-1]
 11080                                  					; get translation

 11084 00000BE5 59                      		pop	cx
 11085 00000BE6 F9                      		stc			; flag error condition
 11086 00000BE7 C3                      		retn
 11087                                  
 11088                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11089                                  
 11090                                  ; set the time of last access for this drive.
 11091                                  ; this is done only for removable media. es:di -> bds
 11092                                  
 11093                                  set_tim:		
 11094 00000BE8 50                      		push	ax
 11095 00000BE9 E88EF8                  		call	GetTickCnt	; Does INT 1A ah=0 & updates daycnt
 11096                                  
 11097                                  ; we have the new time. if we see that the time has passed,
 11098                                  ; then we reset the threshold counter...
 11099                                  
 11100 00000BEC 263B5547                		cmp	dx, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 11101 00000BF0 7506                    		jnz	short setaccess
 11102 00000BF2 263B4D49                		cmp	cx, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 11103                                  		;jz	short done_set
 11104                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11105 00000BF6 740E                    		je	short done_set2
 11106                                  setaccess:				
 11107 00000BF8 C606[1D01]00            		mov	byte [accesscount], 0
 11108 00000BFD 26895547                		mov	[es:di+47h], dx	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 11109 00000C01 26894D49                		mov	[es:di+49h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 11110                                  done_set:				
 11111 00000C05 F8                      		clc
 11112                                  done_set2:		; 12/12/2022
 11113 00000C06 58                      		pop	ax
 11114 00000C07 C3                      		retn

 11116                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11117                                  
 11118                                  ; this routine is called if an error occurs while formatting or verifying.
 11119                                  ; it resets the drive,and decrements the retry count.
 11120                                  ; on entry - ds:di - points to bds for the drive
 11121                                  ;	     bp    - contains retry count
 11122                                  ; on exit    flags indicate result of decrementing retry count
 11123                                  
 11124                                  again:	
 11125 00000C08 E87004                  		call	ResetDisk
 11126 00000C0B 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6
 11127 00000C0E 7402                    		jz	short dont_dec_retry_count ; If	it is a	media change error
 11128                                  					; do not decrement retry count.
 11129 00000C10 4D                      		dec	bp		; decrement retry count
 11130 00000C11 C3                      		retn
 11131                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11132                                  
 11133                                  dont_dec_retry_count:			
 11134 00000C12 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 11135 00000C14 C3                      		retn

 11241                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11242                                  ; Do_Generic_IOCtl: perform generic ioctl request
 11243                                  ;
 11244                                  ;    input: AL contains logical drive
 11245                                  ;
 11246                                  ;	functions are dispatched through a call. On return, carry indicates
 11247                                  ;	error code in al. Note::bES:b& ds undefined on return from
 11248                                  ;	subfunctions.
 11249                                  ;
 11250                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11251                                  
 11252                                  ; 11/03/2019
 11253                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11254                                  do_generic_ioctl:			; 2C7h:0C6Bh = 70h:31DBh
 11255 00000C45 E883F8                  		call	SetDrive	; ES:DI	Points to bds for drive
 11256 00000C48 06                      		push	es
 11257 00000C49 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	Points to request header
 11258 00000C4D 26807F0D08              		cmp	byte [es:bx+0Dh], 8 ; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 11259                                  					; RAWIO
 11260 00000C52 268A470E                		mov	al, [es:bx+0Eh]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MINORFUNCTION]
 11261 00000C56 07                      		pop	es
 11262 00000C57 7525                    		jnz	short IoctlFuncErr
 11263                                  
 11264                                  		; cas note: Could do the above two blocks in reverse order.
 11265                                  		; Would have to preserve al for SetDrive
 11266                                  
 11267                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11268 00000C59 BE[160C]                		mov	si, IoReadJumpTable
 11269                                  		;mov	si, 0C3Ch	; IoReadJumpTable
 11270                                  					; at 2C7h:0C3Ch	= 70h:31ACh
 11271 00000C5C A820                    		test	al, 20h		; GEN_IOCTL_FN_TST ; test of req. function
 11272 00000C5E 7503                    		jnz	short NotGenericWrite ; function is a read.
 11273                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11274 00000C60 BE[290C]                		mov	si, IoWriteJumpTable
 11275                                  		;mov	si, 0C4Fh	; IoWriteJumpTable
 11276                                  					; at 2C7h:0C4Fh	= 70h:31BFh
 11277                                  NotGenericWrite:			
 11278 00000C63 24DF                    		and	al, 0DFh	; ~GEN_IOCTL_FN_TST ; get rid of read/write bit
 11279 00000C65 2C40                    		sub	al, 40h		; offset for base function
 11280 00000C67 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, [cs:si]
 11281 00000C6A 7712                    		ja	short IoctlFuncErr
 11282 00000C6C 98                      		cbw
 11283 00000C6D D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
 11284 00000C6F 46                      		inc	si
 11285 00000C70 01C6                    		add	si, ax
 11286 00000C72 2EFF14                  		call	near [cs:si]
 11287                                  		;call	word ptr cs:[si]
 11288 00000C75 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 11289                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 11290                                  					; 2C7h:30h = 70h:25A0h
 11291 00000C7A B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Return this status in	case of	carry
 11292 00000C7C C3                      		retn			; Pass carry flag through to exit code
 11293                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11294                                  
 11295                                  		; Cmd_Error_Proc is called as a procedure and also use
 11296                                  		; as a fall through from above

 11306                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11307                                  ;**	GetDeviceParameters:
 11308                                  ;
 11309                                  ;	GetDeviceParameters implements the generic ioctl function:
 11310                                  ;	majorcode=RAWIO, minorcode=GetDeviceParameters (60h)
 11311                                  ;
 11312                                  ;	ENTRY	(ES:di) = BDS for drive
 11313                                  ;		PtrSav = long pointer to request header
 11314                                  ;	EXIT	??? BUGBUG
 11315                                  ;	USES	??? BUGBUG
 11316                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11317                                  
 11318                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11319                                  GetDeviceParameters:
 11320                                  		; Copy info from bds to the device parameters packet
 11321                                  
 11322 00000C81 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 11323 00000C85 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 11324                                  					; (DS:BX) = return buffer

 11326 00000C8C 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]
 11327 00000C8F 268B4523                		mov	ax, [es:di+35]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]

 11329                                  					; Mask off other bits

 11334 00000CA2 884706                  		mov	[bx+6],	al	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_MEDIATYPE]
 11335                                  					
 11336                                  		; copy recommended bpb
 11337 00000CA5 8D7527                  		lea	si, [di+39]	; [di+BDS.rbytespersec]	= [di+BDS.R_BPB]
 11338 00000CA8 F60701                  		test	byte [bx], 1	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS]
 11339                                  					; BUILD_DEVICE_BPB

 11342 00000CAE 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]

 11344                                  					; 2C7h:30h = 70h:25A0h

 11349 00000CBA 720F                    		jb	short GetParmRet

 11351                                  					; Use this subfield of bds instead
 11352                                  UseBpbPresent:

 11528                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11529                                  ; FormatTrack:
 11530                                  ; if specialfunction byte is 1,then this is a status call to see if there is
 11531                                  ; rom support for the combination of sec/trk and # of cyln,and if the
 11532                                  ; combination is legal. if specialfunction byte is 0,then format the track.
 11533                                  ;
 11534                                  ; input: ES:di points to bds for drive
 11535                                  ;
 11536                                  ; output:
 11537                                  ;	for status call:
 11538                                  ;	specialfunction byte set to:
 11539                                  ;		0 - rom support + legal combination
 11540                                  ;		1 - no rom support
 11541                                  ;		2 - illegal combination
 11542                                  ;		3 - no media present
 11543                                  ;	carry cleared.
 11544                                  ;
 11545                                  ;	for format track:
 11546                                  ;		carry set if error
 11547                                  ;
 11548                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11549                                  
 11550                                  ; 16/03/2019

 11700                                  		; Check specialfunctions to see if DO_FAST_FORMAT has been

 11702                                  		; routine. If fast format has been specified we should get the
 11703                                  		; number of tracks to be verified and check it to see if it is
 11704                                  		; > 255. If it is then it is an error and we should go to

 11812                                  
 11813                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11814                                  
 11815                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 11816                                  
 11817                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11818                                  ;
 11819                                  ; TrackIo:
 11820                                  ;    performs track read/write/verify
 11821                                  ;
 11822                                  ;   input:
 11823                                  ;      rFlag	- 2 = read
 11824                                  ;		  3 = write
 11825                                  ;		  4 = verify
 11826                                  ;      AX	- Index into track table of first sector to io
 11827                                  ;      CX	- Number of sectors to io
 11828                                  ;      Xfer_Seg:BX - Transfer address
 11829                                  ;      ES:DI	- Pointer to bds
 11830                                  ;      CurTrk	- Current cylinder
 11831                                  ;      CurHd	- Current head
 11832                                  ;
 11833                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11834                                  
 11835                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11836                                  		
 11837                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11838                                  TrackIo:	
 11839                                  					; Procedure `disk' will pop stack to
 11840 00000EF0 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; SpSav	and return if error
 11841 00000EF4 E844F9                  		call	checksingle	; Ensure correct disk is in drv
 11842 00000EF7 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1
 11843                                  					; See if we have already set	disk
 11844 00000EFC 7407                    		jz	short Dptalreadyset ; base table
 11845 00000EFE 50                      		push	ax		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 11846 00000EFF 51                      		push	cx
 11847 00000F00 E896FA                  		call	iosetup
 11848 00000F03 59                      		pop	cx
 11849 00000F04 58                      		pop	ax
 11850                                  Dptalreadyset:				; Point si at the table entry of the			
 11851 00000F05 BE[3B05]                		mov	si, tracktable	; first sector to be io'd
 11852 00000F08 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
 11853 00000F0A D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
 11854 00000F0C 01C6                    		add	si, ax
 11855                                  
 11856                                  		; WE WANT:
 11857                                  		; CX to	be the number of times we have to loop
 11858                                  		; DX to	be the number of sectors we read on each iteration
 11859                                  		
 11860 00000F0E BA0100                  		mov	dx, 1
 11861                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11862 00000F11 26F6452308              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 8
 11863                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 8 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11864                                  					; good_tracklayout
 11865 00000F16 7402                    		jz	short ionextsector
 11866                                  		
 11867 00000F18 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx		; HEY! We can read all secs in one blow
 11868                                  ionextsector:				
 11869 00000F1A 51                      		push	cx
 11870 00000F1B 52                      		push	dx
 11871 00000F1C 46                      		inc	si
 11872 00000F1D 46                      		inc	si		; Skip over the	cylinder and head in
 11873                                  					; the track table
 11874 00000F1E AC                      		lodsb			; Get sector ID	from track table
 11875 00000F1F A2[3101]                		mov	[cursec], al
 11876                                  
 11877                                  		; assumptions for a fixed disk multi-track disk	i/o
 11878                                  		; 1). In the input CX (# of sectors to go) to TrackIo,
 11879                                  		;     only CL is valid.
 11880                                  		; 2). Sector size should be set	to 512 bytes.
 11881                                  		; 3). Good track layout
 11882                                  		
 11883                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11884 00000F22 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 11885                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11886                                  					; fnon_removable ; Fixed disk?
 11887 00000F27 7414                    		jz	short IoRemovable ; No
 11888                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11889 00000F29 F606[2F05]80            		test	byte [multrk_flag], 80h
 11890                                  		;test	word [multrk_flag], 80h ; MULTI_TRK_ON
 11891                                  						; Allow multi-track operation?
 11892 00000F2E 740D                    		jz	short IoRemovable ; No,don't do that.

 11896 00000F39 5A                      		pop	dx

 11899 00000F3C C3                      		retn

 11901                                  
 11902                                  IoRemovable:

 11904                                  					; table	and save it

 11910                                  					; Fetch	EOT while ds-> Bios_Data

 11920                                  					; sector size

 11938                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11939                                  
 11940                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11941                                  ;
 11942                                  ; The sector size in bytes needs to be converted to an index value for the ibm
 11943                                  ; rom. (0=>128,1=>256,2=>512,3=>1024). It is assumed that only these values
 11944                                  ; are permissible.
 11945                                  ;
 11946                                  ; On Input   AX contains sector size in bytes
 11947                                  ; On Output  AL Contains index
 11948                                  ; All other registers preserved
 11949                                  ;
 11950                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11951                                  
 11952                                  SectSizeToSectIndex:	
 11953 00000F71 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; (0=>128,1=>256,2=>512,3=>1024)
 11954                                  					; examine upper	byte only
 11955 00000F74 7703                    		ja	short OneK
 11956 00000F76 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; value	in AH is the index!
 11957 00000F78 C3                      		retn
 11958                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11959                                  
 11960                                  OneK:					
 11961 00000F79 B003                    		mov	al, 3
 11962 00000F7B C3                      		retn
 11963                                  
 11964                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================

 11966

 11969 00000F7E B88000                  		mov	ax, 128
 11970 00000F81 D3E0                    		shl	ax, cl
 11971 00000F83 C3                      		retn

 11979                                  ; SetDASD

 11989                                  SetDasd:

 11991                                  					; See if we've previously set dasd type
 11992 00000F89 740C                    		jz	short DoSetDasd
 11993                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11994 00000F8B 26F6452380              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 80h
 11995                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 80h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11996                                  					; set_dasd_true
 11997 00000F90 744A                    		jz	short DasdHasBeenSet
 11998                                  		; 10/12/2022

 12001                                  					; ~set_dasd_true

 12005 00000FA1 B004                    		mov	al, 4

 12007                                  					; DEV_3INCH720KB
 12008 00000FA8 741A                    		jz	short DoSet
 12009 00000FAA 26807D2201              		cmp	byte [es:di+22h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 12010                                  					; DEV_5INCH96TPI

 12019 00000FBC 7506                    		jnz	short DoSet
 12020                                  		;mov	al, 3		; 1.2meg in a 1.2meg drive
 12021                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12022                                  		;inc	al  ; al = 3
 12023                                  		; 18/12/2022

 12041 00000FDA CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	SET TYPE (AT,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS
 12042                                  					; AL = disk type AL = 03h - high-capacity disk in high-capacity	drive
 12043                                  DasdHasBeenSet:				
 12044 00000FDC 268A6513                		mov	ah, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 12045 00000FE0 8826[3701]              		mov	[formt_eot], ah

 12047                                  
 12048                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12049                                  
 12050                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12051                                  
 12052                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12053                                  ;
 12054                                  ; Set Media Type for Format
 12055                                  ; Performs the int 13 with ah = 18h to see if the medium described in the
 12056                                  ; BPB area in the BDS can be handled by the rom.
 12057                                  ; On Input, ES:DI -> current BDS.
 12058                                  ; The status of the operation is returned in AL
 12059                                  ;
 12060                                  ;	- 0 - if the support is available,and the combination is valid.
 12061                                  ;	- 1 - no rom support
 12062                                  ;	- 2 - illegal combination
 12063                                  ;	- 3 - no media present (rom support exists but cannot determine now)
 12064                                  ;
 12065                                  ; Flags also may be altered. All other registers preserved.
 12066                                  ; If the call to rom returns no error,then the current Dpt is "replaced" by
 12067                                  ; the one returned by the rom. This is Done by changing the pointer in [Dpt]
 12068                                  ; to the one returned. the original pointer to the disk base table is stored
 12069                                  ; in TempDpt, until it is restored.
 12070                                  ;
 12071                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12072                                  
 12073                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12074                                  SetMediaForFormat:	
 12075 00000FE5 51                      		push	cx
 12076 00000FE6 52                      		push	dx
 12077                                  
 12078                                  		; If we have a format error, then do not change Dpt, TempDpt.
 12079                                  		; but we need to call int 13h, ah=18h again.
 12080                                  
 12081 00000FE7 803E[3906]01            		cmp	byte [had_format_error], 1
 12082 00000FEC 7425                    		jz	short SkipSaveDskAdr
 12083 00000FEE 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; If already done return 0
 12084 00000FF0 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1
 12085 00000FF5 7502                    		jnz	short DoSetMediaForFormat
 12086 00000FF7 EB7F                    		jmp	SetMediaRet	; Media	already	set
 12087                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12088                                  
 12089                                  DoSetMediaForFormat:			
 12090 00000FF9 06                      		push	es
 12091 00000FFA 56                      		push	si
 12092 00000FFB 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]	; Point to interrupt vectors
 12093 00000FFF 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 12094                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 12095                                  					; Get pointer to disk base table
 12096 00001004 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 12097 00001008 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es	; Save pointer to table
 12098                                  
 12099                                  		; Initialize the head settle time to 0Fh. See the offsets
 12100                                  		; given in dskprm.inc.
 12101                                  
 12102 0000100C 26C644090F              		mov	byte [es:si+9], 0Fh ; [es:si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 12103 00001011 5E                      		pop	si
 12104 00001012 07                      		pop	es
 12105                                  
 12106                                  SkipSaveDskAdr:				
 12107 00001013 268B4D25                		mov	cx, [es:di+25h]	; [es:di+BDS.cylinders]
 12108 00001017 49                      		dec	cx
 12109 00001018 80E503                  		and	ch, 3
 12110 0000101B D0CD                    		ror	ch, 1
 12111 0000101D D0CD                    		ror	ch, 1
 12112 0000101F 86E9                    		xchg	ch, cl
 12113 00001021 260A4D13                		or	cl, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 12114 00001025 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12115 00001029 06                      		push	es
 12116 0000102A 1E                      		push	ds
 12117 0000102B 56                      		push	si
 12118 0000102C 57                      		push	di
 12119 0000102D B418                    		mov	ah, 18h
 12120 0000102F CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - SET MEDIA TYPE	FOR FORMAT (AT model 3x9,XT2,XT286,PS)
 12121                                  					; DL = drive number, CH	= lower	8 bits of number of tracks, CL = sectors per track
 12122 00001031 7233                    		jb	short FormaStatErr
 12123 00001033 803E[3906]01            		cmp	byte [had_format_error], 1
 12124 00001038 7425                    		jz	short skip_disk_base_setting
 12125 0000103A 06                      		push	es		; Save segment returned	by the rom
 12126 0000103B 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]	; Point	to interrupt vector segment
 12127 0000103F 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 12128                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR] (Int 1Eh)
 12129                                  					; Get current disk base	table
 12130 00001044 8936[3A06]              		mov	[tempdpt], si
 12131 00001048 8C06[3C06]              		mov	[tempdpt+2], es ; Save it
 12132 0000104C 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 12133                                  		;mov	es:78h,	di
 12134 00001050 26893E7800              		mov	[es:DSKADR], di
 12135                                  		;pop	word ptr es:7Ah	; replace with one returned by rom
 12136 00001055 268F067A00              		pop	word [es:DSKADR+2]
 12137 0000105A C606[3806]01            		mov	byte [media_set_for_format], 1
 12138                                  skip_disk_base_setting:			
 12139 0000105F 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; Legal	combination + rom support code
 12140                                  		;mov	ds:had_format_error, al	; Reset	the flag
 12141 00001061 A2[3906]                		mov	[had_format_error], al
 12142 00001064 EB0E                    		jmp	short PopStatRet
 12143                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12144                                  
 12145                                  FormaStatErr:
 12146                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12147 00001066 B003                    		mov	al, 3
 12148                                  				
 12149 00001068 80FC0C                  		cmp	ah, 0Ch		; DSK_ILLEGAL_COMBINATION
 12150                                  					; Illegal combination =	0Ch
 12151 0000106B 7406                    		jz	short FormatStatIllegalComb
 12152 0000106D 80FC80                  		cmp	ah, 80h		; DSK_TIMEOUT_ERR
 12153 00001070 7402                    		jz	short FormatStatTimeOut
 12154                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12155                                  		;dec	al
 12156                                  		; 18/12/2022
 12157 00001072 48                      		dec	ax
 12158                                  		; al = 2
 12159                                  		;mov	al, 1		; Function not supported.
 12160                                  		;jmp	short PopStatRet
 12161                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12162                                  
 12163                                  FormatStatIllegalComb:
 12164                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12165                                  		;dec	al	; 3 -> 2 or 2 -> 1
 12166                                  		; 18/12/2022
 12167 00001073 48                      		dec	ax
 12168                                  		; al = 2				
 12169                                  		;mov	al, 2		; Function supported, but
 12170                                  					; Illegal sect/trk,trk combination.
 12171                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12172                                  		;jmp	short PopStatRet
 12173                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12174

 12176                                  		; 10/12/2022

 12179                                  					; Media	not present.
