 13085                                  
 13086                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13087                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13088                                  
 13089                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13090                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13091                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 13092                                  
 13093                                  win386call:				
 13094 00001340 1E                      		push	ds
 13095 00001341 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13096                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13097                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 13098 00001346 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 13099                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 13100 00001348 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 13101 0000134A 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 13102                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 13103 0000134C 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 13104                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13105 0000134E F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13106                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13107 00001351 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13108                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 13109 00001353 8026[CE08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 13110 00001358 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 13111                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13112                                  
 13113                                  Win386Init:	
 13114                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13115 0000135A F6C201                  		test	dl, 1			
 13116                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13117 0000135D 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13118                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 13119 0000135F 800E[CE08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 13120                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 13121                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 13122 00001364 891E[9C08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 13123 00001368 8C06[9E08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 13124                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 13125 0000136C BB[9A08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 13126 0000136F 1E                      		push	ds
 13127 00001370 07                      		pop	es
 13128                                  win_iret:				
 13129 00001371 1F                      		pop	ds
 13130                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022	
 13131 00001372 EB88                    		jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 13132                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13133                                  
 13134                                  handle_multmult:			
 13135 00001374 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 13136 00001376 7515                    		jnz	short try_2
 13137 00001378 1E                      		push	ds
 13138 00001379 E84700                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13139                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13140                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 13141                                  		;dec	bx
 13142 0000137C BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 13143 0000137F 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 13144 00001381 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 13145 00001383 F7D3                    		not	bx
 13146 00001385 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 13147 00001387 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 13148 00001389 43                      		inc	bx
 13149                                  try_1:					
 13150 0000138A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13151 0000138B EBE5                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13152                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13153                                  
 13154                                  try_2:					
 13155 0000138D 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13156 0000138F 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13157 00001391 1E                      		push	ds
 13158                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13159                                  		;xor	di, di
 13160                                  		;dec	di
 13161 00001392 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13162 00001395 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
 13163 00001397 E82900                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13164 0000139A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13165 0000139D 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA
 13166 0000139F F7DF                    		neg	di		; free space in HMA
 13167 000013A1 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13168 000013A3 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13169                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13170                                  		;sub	di, di
 13171                                  		;dec	di
 13172 000013A5 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13173 000013A8 EB16                    		jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13174                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13175                                  
 13176                                  try_4:					
 13177                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13178 000013AA 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13179 000013AE 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13180                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13181                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13182 000013B1 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13183                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13184 000013B4 011E[F508]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13185 000013B8 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA
 13186 000013BA C706[F508]FFFF          		mov	word [FreeHMAPtr], 0FFFFh ; -1
 13187                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13188                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13189                                  InsuffHMA:				
 13190 000013C0 1F                      		pop	ds
 13191                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13192                                  try_3:		
 13193 000013C1 EBAF                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13194                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13195                                  
 13196                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13197                                  ;try_3:					
 13198                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 13199                                  
 13200                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13201                                  
 13202                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13203                                  
 13204                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13205                                  ;
 13206                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13207                                  ;
 13208                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13209                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13210                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13211                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13212                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13213                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13214                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13215                                  ;
 13216                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13217                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13218                                  ;
 13219                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13220                                  
 13221                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13222                                  HMAPtr:
 13223 000013C3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13224                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13225 000013C8 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13226                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13227 000013CC 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13228 000013CF 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13229 000013D1 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13230                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13231 000013D6 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13232 000013D8 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13233                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13234 000013DC 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13235                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13236                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13237 000013E0 C3                      		retn
 13238                                  
 13239                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13240                                  
 13241                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13242                                  
 13243                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13244                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13245                                  
 13246                                  move_sector:
 13247                                  
 13248                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13249                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13250                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13251                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13252                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13253                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13254                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13255                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13256                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13257                                  ;
 13258                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13259                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13260                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13261                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13262                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13263                                  
 13264 000013E1 FC                      		cld
 13265 000013E2 51                      		push	cx
 13266 000013E3 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13267 000013E6 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13268 000013EA 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13269 000013EC 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13270 000013F0 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13271 000013F2 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13272 000013F4 59                      		pop	cx
 13273 000013F5 C3                      		retn
 13274                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13275                                  
 13276                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13277 000013F6 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13278 000013F8 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13279 000013FA 59                      		pop	cx
 13280 000013FB C3                      		retn
 13281                                  
 13282                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13283                                  
 13284                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13285                                  
 13286                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13287                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13288                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13289                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13290                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13291                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13292                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13293                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13294                                  ;
 13295                                  ; input conditions:
 13296                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13297                                  ;
 13298                                  ; output:
 13299                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13300                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13301                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13302                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13303                                  
 13304                                  check_wrap:	
 13305 000013FC 50                      		push	ax
 13306 000013FD 53                      		push	bx
 13307 000013FE 06                      		push	es
 13308 000013FF 57                      		push	di
 13309 00001400 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13310 00001403 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13311                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13312 00001405 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13313                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13314 0000140A 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13315 0000140C 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13316 00001410 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13317 00001412 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13318 00001415 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13319 00001417 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13320 00001419 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13321                                  
 13322                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13323                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13324                                  
 13325 0000141B 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13326 0000141D 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13327                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13328 0000141F 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13329 00001420 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13330                                  					; if on	boundary
 13331                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13332                                  not_on_bound:				
 13333 00001422 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13334 00001425 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13335 00001427 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13336 00001429 40                      		inc	ax
 13337 0000142A 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13338 0000142C 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13339 0000142F 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13340                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13341 00001433 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13342 00001435 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13343 00001436 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13344 00001438 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13345 0000143C F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13346                                  
 13347                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13348                                  
 13349 0000143E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13350 00001440 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13351 00001442 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13352                                  
 13353                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13354                                  
 13355 00001444 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13356 00001446 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13357 00001448 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13358                                  no_head_bound:				
 13359 00001449 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13360 0000144B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13361 0000144C FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13362 0000144E 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13363 00001450 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13364 00001452 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13365 00001455 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13366 00001457 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13367 00001459 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13368 0000145B 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13369 0000145D 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13370 0000145F D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13371 00001461 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13372 00001463 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13373                                  no_wrap:				
 13374 00001465 F8                      		clc
 13375 00001466 5F                      		pop	di
 13376 00001467 07                      		pop	es
 13377 00001468 5B                      		pop	bx
 13378 00001469 58                      		pop	ax
 13379 0000146A C3                      		retn
 13380                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13381                                  
 13382                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13383 0000146B 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13384 0000146D FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13385 0000146F EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13386                                  
 13387                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13388                                  
 13389                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13390                                  
 13391                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13392                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13393                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13394                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13395                                  ;
 13396                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13397                                  
 13398                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13399                                  find_bds:	
 13400 00001471 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13401                                  fbds_1:					
 13402 00001475 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13403 00001479 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13404 0000147B 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13405                                  					; go to next bds
 13406 0000147E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13407 00001481 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13408 00001483 F9                      		stc
 13409                                  fdbs_2:					
 13410 00001484 C3                      		retn
 13411                                  
 13412                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13413                                  
 13414                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13415                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13416                                  doint:
 13417                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13418 00001485 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13419                                  					; get physical drive number
 13420                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13421                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13422                                  		
 13423 00001488 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13424 0000148A 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13425 0000148C 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13426                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13427 0000148E 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13428                                  					; get request code
 13429                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13430 00001491 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13431                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13432 00001494 9D                      		popf
 13433                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13434                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13435 00001495 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13436                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13437                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13438 0000149A 9C                      		pushf
 13439                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13440 0000149B 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13441                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13442                                  dointdone:				
 13443 0000149E C3                      		retn
 13444                                  
 13445                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13446                                  
 13447                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13448                                  
 13449                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13450                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13451                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13452                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13453                                  ;
 13454                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13455                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13456                                  ;
 13457                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13458                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13459                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13460                                  
 13461                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13462                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13463                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13464                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13465                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13466                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13467                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13468                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13469                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13470                                  ;end struc
 13471                                  
 13472                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13473                                  
 13474                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13475                                  ;	ah = function
 13476                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13477                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13478                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13479                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13480                                  ;   output conditions:
 13481                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13482                                  
 13483                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13484                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13485                                  ;
 13486                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13487                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13488                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13489                                  
 13490                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13491                                  
 13492                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13493                                  
 13494 0000149F 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13495                                  
 13496                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13497                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13498                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13499                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13500                                  
 13501                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13502                                  
 13503                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13504                                  
 13505                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13506                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13507                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13508                                  
 13509                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13510 000014A3 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13511 000014A8 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13512 000014AA 53                      		push	bx
 13513 000014AB BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13514 000014AE E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13515 000014B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13516 000014B2 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13517                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13518                                  
 13519                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13520                                  
 13521                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13522                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13523                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13524                                  
 13525                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13526                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13527 000014B4 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13528 000014B6 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13529 000014B8 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13530 000014B9 51                      		push	cx
 13531 000014BA 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13532 000014BC B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13533 000014BE D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13534 000014C0 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13535 000014C4 59                      		pop	cx
 13536 000014C5 58                      		pop	ax
 13537 000014C6 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13538                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13539 000014C8 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13540 000014C9 06                      		push	es
 13541                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13542 000014CA 2EC41E[9F14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13543                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13544                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13545 000014CF 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13546 000014D1 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13547 000014D4 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13548                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13549                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13550 000014D8 07                      		pop	es
 13551 000014D9 5B                      		pop	bx
 13552 000014DA EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13553                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13554                                  
 13555                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13556                                  
 13557                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13558                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13559                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13560                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13561                                  
 13562                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13563 000014DC 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13564                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13565 000014E1 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13566 000014E3 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13567                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13568 000014E8 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13569                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13570 000014EA 50                      		push	ax
 13571 000014EB B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13572                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13573                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13574 000014ED 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13575                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13576                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13577 000014F2 58                      		pop	ax
 13578 000014F3 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13579                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13580                                  
 13581                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13582                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13583                                  
 13584                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13585                                  
 13586                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13587                                  
 13588                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13589                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13590                                  
 13591                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13592 000014F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13593                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13594                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13595 000014F6 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13596                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13597                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13598                                  
 13599                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13600                                  
 13601 000014FB A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13602 000014FE 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13603 00001501 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13604                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13605                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13606 00001503 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13607 00001508 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13608                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13609                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13610                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13611 0000150A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13612                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13613                                  		
 13614 0000150F 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13615                                  		
 13616 00001510 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13617                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13618 00001515 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13619                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13620                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13621 00001517 9D                      		popf
 13622 00001518 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13623                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13624 0000151A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13625 0000151B CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13626                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13627                                  
 13628                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13629                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13630                                  ; a changeline error.
 13631                                  
 13632                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13633 0000151E 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13634                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13635 00001520 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13636 00001523 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13637 00001525 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13638 00001527 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13639 00001529 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13640 0000152E 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13641                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13642                                  					; never	would
 13643 00001530 53                      		push	bx
 13644 00001531 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13645 00001534 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13646 00001537 5B                      		pop	bx
 13647                                  int13b:					
 13648 00001538 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13649 00001539 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13650                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13651                                  
 13652                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13653                                  
 13654                                  goterr13:				
 13655 0000153B 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13656 0000153E 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13657                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13658 00001540 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13659 00001543 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13660 00001545 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13661 0000154A 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13662                                  
 13663 0000154C 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13664                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13665                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13666                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13667 00001551 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13668                                  
 13669 00001553 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13670                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13671                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13672 00001555 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13673                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13674                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13675 0000155A A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13676 0000155D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13677 0000155F 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13678 00001561 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13679 00001563 53                      		push	bx
 13680 00001564 51                      		push	cx
 13681 00001565 52                      		push	dx
 13682 00001566 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13683                                  loop_ecc:				
 13684 00001569 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13685                                  
 13686                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13687                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13688                                  ;
 13689                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13690                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13691                                  ; track.
 13692                                  ;
 13693                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13694                                  ; this request.
 13695                                  ;
 13696                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13697                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13698                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13699                                  ;
 13700 0000156C E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13701                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13702                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13703 0000156F 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13704                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13705 00001574 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13706 00001576 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13707 00001579 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13708 0000157B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13709 0000157E 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13710                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13711                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13712                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13713 00001580 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13714                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13715                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13716                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13717                                  ok11_op:				
 13718 00001582 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13719 00001586 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13720 00001588 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13721                                  					; add 200h to address
 13722 0000158A FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13723 0000158C FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13724 0000158E EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13725                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13726                                  
 13727                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13728                                  
 13729                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13730 00001590 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13731                                  ok11_exit:				
 13732 00001591 5A                      		pop	dx
 13733 00001592 59                      		pop	cx
 13734 00001593 5B                      		pop	bx
 13735 00001594 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13736                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13737                                  
 13738                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13739                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13740                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13741                                  
 13742                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13743 00001596 06                      		push	es
 13744 00001597 53                      		push	bx
 13745 00001598 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13746 0000159B 1E                      		push	ds
 13747 0000159C 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13748 0000159D B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13749                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13750                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13751 000015A0 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13752                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13753 000015A5 5B                      		pop	bx
 13754 000015A6 07                      		pop	es
 13755 000015A7 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13756 000015A9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13757 000015AC 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13758                                  
 13759                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13760                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13761                                  
 13762                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13763 000015AE 56                      		push	si
 13764 000015AF 57                      		push	di
 13765 000015B0 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13766 000015B2 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13767 000015B5 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13768 000015B8 5F                      		pop	di
 13769 000015B9 5E                      		pop	si
 13770 000015BA EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13771                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13772                                  
 13773                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13774                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13775                                  
 13776                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13777 000015BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13778 000015BF FB                      		sti
 13779 000015C0 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13780 000015C3 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13781                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13782                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13783 000015C5 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13784 000015C8 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13785 000015CA 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13786 000015CD 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13787 000015CF 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13788                                  
 13789                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13790                                  
 13791                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13792                                  
 13793 000015D1 52                      		push	dx
 13794 000015D2 51                      		push	cx
 13795 000015D3 53                      		push	bx
 13796 000015D4 50                      		push	ax
 13797 000015D5 55                      		push	bp
 13798 000015D6 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13799 000015D8 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13800 000015DA D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13801 000015DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13802 000015DE D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13803 000015E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13804 000015E2 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13805 000015E4 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13806                                  
 13807                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13808                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13809                                  
 13810 000015E8 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13811 000015EA E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13812                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13813                                  
 13814                                  no_skip_first:				
 13815 000015ED D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13816 000015EF B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13817 000015F1 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13818                                  
 13819                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13820                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13821                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13822                                  ;
 13823                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13824                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13825                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13826                                  ; in error.
 13827                                  
 13828 000015F3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13829 000015F5 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13830                                  
 13831                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13832                                  
 13833 000015F7 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13834                                  					; set up head number
 13835 000015FA E888FE                  		call	doint
 13836 000015FD E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13837                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13838                                  
 13839                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13840 00001600 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13841 00001602 F9                      		stc
 13842 00001603 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13843                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13844                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13845                                  
 13846                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13847                                  
 13848                                  intverify:				
 13849 00001606 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13850 00001607 53                      		push	bx
 13851 00001608 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13852 00001609 07                      		pop	es
 13853                                  dosimple:				
 13854 0000160A BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13855                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13856                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13857                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13858 0000160D 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13859                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13860 00001612 5B                      		pop	bx
 13861 00001613 07                      		pop	es
 13862 00001614 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13863                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13864                                  
 13865                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13866                                  
 13867                                  intformat:				
 13868 00001617 06                      		push	es
 13869 00001618 53                      		push	bx
 13870 00001619 56                      		push	si
 13871 0000161A 57                      		push	di
 13872 0000161B 1E                      		push	ds
 13873                                  
 13874                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13875                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13876                                  
 13877 0000161C 06                      		push	es
 13878 0000161D 1E                      		push	ds
 13879 0000161E 07                      		pop	es
 13880 0000161F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13881 00001620 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13882 00001622 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13883 00001625 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13884 00001628 1F                      		pop	ds
 13885 00001629 5F                      		pop	di
 13886 0000162A 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13887 0000162B EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13888                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13889                                  
 13890                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13891                                  ; the first block.
 13892                                  ;
 13893                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13894                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13895                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13896                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13897                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13898                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13899                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13900                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13901                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13902                                  
 13903                                  doblock:
 13904                                  
 13905                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13906                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13907                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13908                                  				
 13909 0000162D 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13910                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13911 00001630 51                      		push	cx
 13912 00001631 06                      		push	es
 13913 00001632 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13914                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13915 00001633 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13916 00001636 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13917                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13918 0000163A 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13919                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13920 0000163F 5F                      		pop	di
 13921 00001640 07                      		pop	es
 13922 00001641 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13923 00001643 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13924 00001645 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13925 00001647 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13926                                  doblockflop:				
 13927 00001649 59                      		pop	cx
 13928                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13929 0000164A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13930 0000164C 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13931 0000164E 50                      		push	ax
 13932 0000164F 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13933 00001651 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13934                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13935                                  
 13936                                  doblocklast:				
 13937 00001653 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13938 00001655 50                      		push	ax
 13939                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13940 00001656 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13941 00001659 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13942 0000165B 58                      		pop	ax
 13943 0000165C 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13944                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13945 0000165F 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13946 00001661 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13947 00001663 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13948 00001665 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13949 00001667 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13950                                  					; then we are done already.
 13951 00001669 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13952                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13953 0000166B E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13954 0000166E EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13955                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13956                                  
 13957                                  bufferx:				
 13958 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13959                                  					; set up head number
 13960                                  buffer:					
 13961 00001673 53                      		push	bx
 13962 00001674 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13963 00001677 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13964 0000167A 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13965                                  					
 13966                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13967                                  
 13968 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 13969 0000167D 1E                      		push	ds
 13970 0000167E 56                      		push	si
 13971 0000167F 57                      		push	di
 13972 00001680 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13973 00001681 06                      		push	es
 13974 00001682 1F                      		pop	ds
 13975 00001683 07                      		pop	es
 13976 00001684 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13977 00001687 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13978 00001688 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13979 0000168A E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13980 0000168D 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13981                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13982 0000168E 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13983 0000168F 5E                      		pop	si
 13984 00001690 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13985                                  
 13986                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13987                                  
 13988 00001691 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13989                                  					; get drive number
 13990 00001693 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13991 00001696 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13992                                  					;
 13993                                  					; ah is	function
 13994                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 13995                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 13996                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 13997                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 13998                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 13999 00001699 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14000 0000169C 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14001 0000169D 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14002 0000169F EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14003                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14004                                  
 14005                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14006                                  
 14007                                  doread:					
 14008 000016A1 06                      		push	es
 14009 000016A2 53                      		push	bx
 14010 000016A3 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14011 000016A4 07                      		pop	es
 14012 000016A5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14013 000016A8 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14014 000016AA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14015                                  					; get drive number
 14016 000016AD E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14017                                  					; ah = function
 14018                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14019                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14020                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14021 000016B0 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14022 000016B3 5B                      		pop	bx
 14023 000016B4 07                      		pop	es
 14024 000016B5 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14025 000016B7 56                      		push	si
 14026 000016B8 57                      		push	di
 14027 000016B9 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14028 000016BB BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14029 000016BE E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 14030 000016C1 5F                      		pop	di
 14031 000016C2 5E                      		pop	si
 14032                                  
 14033                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14034                                  
 14035                                  dotail:					
 14036 000016C3 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14037 000016C4 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14038 000016C7 41                      		inc	cx
 14039 000016C8 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14040 000016CB F8                      		clc
 14041 000016CC FEC8                    		dec	al
 14042 000016CE 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14043                                  
 14044                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14045                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14046                                  
 14047 000016D0 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14048 000016D3 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14049 000016D6 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14050                                  
 14051                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14052                                  
 14053                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14054                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14055                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14056                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14057                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14058                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14059                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14060                                  
 14061                                  bad13:					
 14062 000016D9 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14063 000016DB 5D                      		pop	bp
 14064 000016DC 5B                      		pop	bx
 14065 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14066 000016DE 59                      		pop	cx
 14067 000016DF 5A                      		pop	dx
 14068 000016E0 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14069 000016E2 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14070                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14071                                  
 14072                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14073 000016E5 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14074                                  
 14075                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14076                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14077                                  		;db 	0
 14078                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14079                                  
 14080                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14081                                  
 14082                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14083                                  
 14084                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14085                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 14086                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14087                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14088                                  
 14089                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14090                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14091 000016E8 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14092 000016EC BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14093 000016EF 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 14094 000016F0 07                      		pop	es
 14095 000016F1 E9C4EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 14096                                  
 14097                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14098                                  
 14099                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14100                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14101                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14102                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14103                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14104                                  
 14105                                  install_bds:		
 14106 000016F4 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14107 000016F5 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14108                                  
 14109                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14110                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14111                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14112 000016F8 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14113                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14114 000016FA 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14115 000016FE 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14116                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14117 00001701 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14118 00001703 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14119 00001705 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14120                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14121 00001709 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14122 0000170C 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14123                                  					; we don't own it
 14124 00001711 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14125                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14126 00001714 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14127 00001717 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14128                                  next_bds:				
 14129 0000171B 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14130                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14131 0000171E 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14132 00001720 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14133                                  					; install bds
 14134 00001723 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14135 00001725 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14136                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14137 0000172A 1F                      		pop	ds
 14138                                  
 14139                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14140                                  ;
 14141                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14142                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14143                                  ;
 14144                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14145                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
