 15387                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15388                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15389                                  
 15390                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15391                                  
 15392                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15393                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15394                                  ;
 15395                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15396                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15397                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15398                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15399                                  ;
 15400                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15401                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15402                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15403                                  
 15404                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15405                                  
 15406                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15407                                  
 15408                                  struc	DPB
 15409 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15410 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15411 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15412 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15413 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15414 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15415 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15416 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15417 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15418 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15419                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15420 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15421 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15422 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15423 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15424 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15425                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15426 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15427 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15428 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15429                                  .size:
 15430                                  endstruc
 15431                                  
 15432                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15433                                  
 15434                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 15491                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15492                                  
 15493                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15494                                  ;
 15495                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15496                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15497                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15498                                  ;
 15499                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15500                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15501                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15502                                  ;
 15503                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15504                                  
 15505                                  struc A_BPB
 15506 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15507 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15508 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15509 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15510 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15511 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15512 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15513 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15514 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15515 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15516 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15517 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15518 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15519 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15520 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15521                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15522                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15523                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15524                                  .size:
 15525                                  endstruc
 15526                                  
 15527                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 15528 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 15529 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 15530 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 15531 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 15532 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15533 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 15534 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 15535 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 15536                                  endstruc

 15571                                  ;** Arena Header
 15572                                  
 15573                                  struc ARENA
 15574 00000000 ??                      .SIGNATURE:	resb 1		; 4D for valid item, 5A for last item

 15784                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15785                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15786                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15787                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15788                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15789                                  									  
 15790                                  ;*******************************					  
 15791                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15792                                  ;*******************************					  
 15793                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15794                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15795                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15796                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15797                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15798                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15799                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15800                                  ;For all others:							  
 15801                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15802                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15803                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15804                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15805                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15806                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15807                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15808                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15809                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15810                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15811                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15812                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15813                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15814                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15815                                  ;									  
 15816                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15817                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15818                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15819                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15820                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15821                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15822                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15823                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15824                                  ;									  
 15825                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15826                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15827                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15828                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15829                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15830                                  ;									  
 15831                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15832                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15833                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15834                                  ;									  
 15835                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15836                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15837                                  ;									  
 15838                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15839                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15840                                  ;									  
 15841                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15842                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15843                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15844                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15845                                  ;						called. 		  
 15846                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15847                                  ;									  
 15848                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15849                                  ;									  
 15850                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15851                                  ;									  
 15852                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15853                                  ;									  
 15854                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15855                                  ;									  
 15856                                  
 15857                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 15858                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 15859 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 15860 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 15861                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 15862 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15863 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15864 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 15865 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 15866                                  endstruc

 15975                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15976                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15977                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15978                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15979                                  
 15980                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 15981                                  ;
 15982                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 15983                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 15984                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 15985                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 15986                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 15987                                  ;
 15988                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 15989                                  ;
 15990                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 15991                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 15992                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 15993                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 15994                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 15995                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 15996                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 15997                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 15998                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 15999                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16000                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16001                                  
 16002                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16003                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16004                                  
 16005                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16006                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16007 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16008 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16009 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16010 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16011 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16012 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16013                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16014 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)

 16040                                  ; system file table
 16041                                  
 16042                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16043                                  ;
 16044                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16045                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16046                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16047                                  
 16048                                  struc	SF
 16049 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16050 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16051 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16052                                  .size:
 16053                                  endstruc
 16054                                  
 16055                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16056                                  ;
 16057                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16058                                  
 16059                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16060 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16061                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16062 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16063 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16064 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16065                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16066                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16067                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16068                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16069                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16070                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16071                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16072                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16073                                  					;
 16074                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16075                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16076                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16077                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16078                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16079                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16080                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16081                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16082                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16083                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16084                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16085                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16086 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16087                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16088                                  					; points to net device header if
 16089                                  					; remote
 16090 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16091                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 16092 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16093 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16094 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16095 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16096                                  ;
 16097                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16098                                  ; ID
 16099                                  ;
 16100 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16101 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 16102 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 16103                                  ;
 16104                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 16105                                  ;
 16106 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 16107                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 16108                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 16109                                  					; disk changed errors.
 16110                                  ; SHARING INFO
 16111 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 16112 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 16113 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 16114 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 16115 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 16116 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 16117                                  .size:
 16118                                  endstruc

 16390                                  	;IF	STACKSW

 16397                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16398                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16399                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16400                                  
 16401                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16402                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16403                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16404                                  
 16405                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16406                                  ;
 16407                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16408                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16409                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16410                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16411                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16412                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16413                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16414                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16415                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16416                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16417                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16418                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16419                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16420                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16421                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16422                                  ;
 16423                                  
 16424                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16425                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16426                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16427                                  ;
 16428                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16429                                  ;
 16430                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16431                                  ;
 16432                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16433                                  ;
 16434                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16435                                  ;
 16436                                  
 16437                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16438                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16439                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16440                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16441                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16442                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16443                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16444                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16445                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16446                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16447                                  
 16448                                  		;EVEN
 16449                                  ;align 2
 16450                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16451                                  
 16452 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16453 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16454 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16455 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16456 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16457 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16458                                  
 16459 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16460 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16461 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16462                                  
 16463                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16464                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16465                                  
 16466                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16467                                  
 16468 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16469                                  
 16470                                  int02:
 16471                                  
 16472                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16473                                  ;
 16474                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16475                                  ;
 16476                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16477                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16478                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16479                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16480                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16481                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16482                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16483                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16484                                  ;
 16485                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16486                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16487                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16488                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16489                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16490                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16491                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16492                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16493                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16494                                  ;
 16495                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16496                                  
 16497 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16498 00000017 06                      	push	es

 16747                                  ;********************************************************************
 16748                                  ;common routines
 16749                                  ;********************************************************************
 16750                                  
 16751                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16752                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16753                                  ; service routine
 16754                                  
 16755                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16756                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16757                                  
 16758                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16759                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16760                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16761                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16762                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16763                                  
 16764                                  do_int_stacks:
 16765 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16766 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16767 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16768 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16769 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16770 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16771                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16772                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16773                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16774 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16775 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16776 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16777                                  
 16778 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16779                                  
 16780                                  found02:
 16781 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16782 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16783                                  
 16784 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16785                                  
 16786 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16787                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16788                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16789                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16790                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16791 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16792 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16793                                  
 16794                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16795                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16796                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16797                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16798                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16799                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16800                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16801                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16802                                  
 16803                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16804 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16805 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16806 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16807 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16808 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16809 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16810 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16811 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16812                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16813                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16814 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16815                                  
 16816 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16817                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16818 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16819                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16820                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16821                                  
 16822 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16823                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16824 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16825                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16826                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16827 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16828 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16829                                  
 16830                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16831                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16832                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16833 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16834 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16835                                  
 16836 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16837 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16838 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16839 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16840 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16841                                  
 16842                                  notfree02:
 16843 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16844 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16845                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16846                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16847                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16848 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16849                                  
 16850                                  findnext02:
 16851 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 16852 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 16853                                  
 16854                                  foundbad02:
 16855 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16856 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 16857 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 16858                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16859                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 16860                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16861 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 16862 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 16863                                  
 16864                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16865                                  
 16866                                  ; Common routines
 16867                                  
 16868                                  longpath:
 16869                                  	; 21/03/2019
 16870 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 16871                                  lploopp:
 16872                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16873                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 16874                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16875 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 16876 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 16877                                  
 16878 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 16879                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16880                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 16881                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16882 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16883 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 16884 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 16885                                  
 16886 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 16887 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 16888                                  
 16889                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16890                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 16891                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16892 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 16893                                  inuse:
 16894 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16895 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 16896 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 16897 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 16898                                  found:
 16899 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 16900                                  fatal:
 16901 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 16902 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 16903 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16904 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 16905 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 16906 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 16907                                  
 16908 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 16909 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 16910                                  
 16911                                  skip_nmis:
 16912 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 16913 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 16914 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 16915 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 16916                                  
 16917 0000020E 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 16918 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 16919 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 16920                                  ;SR;
 16921                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 16922                                  ;
 16923 00000215 50                      	push	ax
 16924 00000216 1E                      	push	ds
 16925                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 16926                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 16927                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16928 00000217 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 16929 0000021A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16930                                  
 16931                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 16932 0000021C F606[CE08]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 16933 00000221 1F                      	pop	ds
 16934 00000222 58                      	pop	ax
 16935 00000223 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 16936                                  
 16937                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)
 16938                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 16939                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16940 00000225 9A[CF08]7000            	call	DOSBIODATASEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; 0070h:08D1h
 16941                                  ;
 16942                                  ;SR; We do not bother about the returned status of this call. 
 16943                                  ;
 16944                                  fatal_loop:
 16945 0000022A AC                      	lodsb
 16946 0000022B 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 16947 0000022D 7408                    	je	short fatal_done
 16948                                  
 16949 0000022F B307                    	mov	bl,7
 16950 00000231 B40E                    	mov	ah,14
 16951 00000233 CD10                    	int	10h			; whoops, this enables ints
 16952 00000235 EBF3                    	jmp	short fatal_loop
 16953                                  
 16954                                  fatal_done:
 16955 00000237 EBFE                    	jmp	short fatal_done
 16956

 16958                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSINIT1.ASM, 1991)

 18103                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 18104                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18105                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18106                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18107                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18108                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18109                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18110                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18111                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18112                                  ;
 18113                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18114                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18115                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18116                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18117                                  ; been patched.

 18394 000007D9 880E[A902]              	mov     [command_line],cl ; command line length (except CR)
 18395                                  
 18396                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18397                                  
 18398                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 18399                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 18400                                  ;   which follow....)
 18401                                  
 18402                                  retry:
 18403 000007DD BA[1D34]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18404                                  
 18405                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18406                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18407                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18408                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18409                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18410                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18411                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18412                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18413                                  
 18414                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18415                                  
 18416 000007E0 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 18417 000007E1 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 18418 000007E4 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18419 000007E6 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 18420 000007E8 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18421 000007EA CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 18422 000007EC 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 18423                                  
 18424 000007EE 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18425 000007F0 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 18426 000007F2 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 18427 000007F4 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 18428                                  
 18429                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18430                                  
 18431                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18432                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18433                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18434                                  
 18435                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18436                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 18437 000007F6 8B1E[9202]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 18438 000007FA 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18439                                  
 18440                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18441                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18442                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18443                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18444                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18445                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18446                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18447                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18448                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18449                                  ;
 18450                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18451                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18452                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18453                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18454                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18455                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18456                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 18457                                  
 18458                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18459                                  	;mov	cx,[config_envlen]
 18460                                          ;jcxz	no_env		; use config_wrkseg only if there's env data

 19218                                  
 19219                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19220                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19221                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19222                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19223                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19224                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19225                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19226                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19227                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19228                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19229                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19230                                  ;
 19231                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19232                                  
 19233                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19234                                  update_arena:
 19235 00000986 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19236 00000987 57                      	push	di
 19237 00000988 51                      	push	cx
 19238 00000989 52                      	push	dx
 19239                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19240                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19241                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19242                                  	; ds = cs 
 19243 0000098A C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19244 0000098E 4F                      	dec	di
 19245 0000098F 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19246                                  						;  before sysvar
 19247 00000990 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19248                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19249 00000992 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19250 00000997 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19251 00000999 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19252                                  
 19253                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19254 0000099B 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19255 000009A0 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19256 000009A2 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19257 000009A4 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19258 000009A6 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19259                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19260 000009A8 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19261                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19262 000009AC C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19263 000009B2 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19264                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19265 000009B4 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19266 000009B8 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19267                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19268                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19269 000009BA 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19270 000009BD 5A                      	pop	dx
 19271 000009BE 59                      	pop	cx
 19272 000009BF 5F                      	pop	di
 19273 000009C0 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19274 000009C1 C3                      	retn
 19275                                  ;
 19276                                  ; M012 : END
 19277                                  ;

 19294                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19295                                  ;
 19296                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19297                                  ;
 19298                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19299                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19300                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19301                                  ;
 19302                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19303                                  ;
 19304                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19305                                  
 19306                                  AllocHMA:
 19307                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19308                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19309                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19310                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19311                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19312                                  
 19313                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19314                                  ;
 19315                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19316                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19317                                  ;	push	ax
 19318                                  ;	popf
 19319                                  ;	pushf
 19320                                  ;	pop	ax
 19321                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19322                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19323                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19324                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19325                                  
 19326                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19327                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19328                                  
 19329 000009CD 1E                      	push	ds
 19330                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19331                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19332                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19333 000009CE B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19334 000009D1 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19335                                  
 19336 000009D3 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19337 000009D6 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19338                                  
 19339 000009D8 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19340 000009DB CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19341                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19342                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19343                                  
 19344 000009DD 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19345                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 19346 000009E1 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19347                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19348                                  
 19349 000009E5 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19350 000009E7 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19351                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19352 000009EA FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19353 000009EE 48                      	dec	ax
 19354 000009EF 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19355                                  
 19356                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19357                                  
 19358 000009F1 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19359 000009F3 CD15                    	int	15h
 19360                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19361                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19362                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19363 000009F5 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19364                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19365                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19366 000009F8 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19367                                  allocHMA_1:
 19368 000009FA B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19369                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19370 000009FC FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19371 00000A00 48                      	dec	ax
 19372 00000A01 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 19373                                  
 19374 00000A03 E88901                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 19375 00000A06 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19376                                  
 19377 00000A08 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19378 00000A0B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19379 00000A0D 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 19380 00000A14 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 19381                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 19382                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19383 00000A1B 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 19384                                  
 19385                                  ; 11/12/2022
 19386                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 19387                                  ;	; cf=0
 19388                                  ;	;clc
 19389                                  ;	pop	ds
 19390                                  ;	retn

 19464                                  
 19465                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19466                                  ;
 19467                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19468                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19469                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19470                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19471                                  ;
 19472                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19473                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19474                                  ;
 19475                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19476                                  
 19477                                  StartVDHead:
 19478                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19479                                  
 19480 00000A45 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19481 00000A49 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19482 00000A4B 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19483 00000A4D 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19484 00000A4F 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19485                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19486 00000A50 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19487                                  VDiskSig1:
 19488 00000A57 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19489                                  
 19490                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19491                                  
 19492 00000A5C 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19493                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19494 00000A62 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19495 00000A71 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19496 00000A73 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19497                                  VDInt19:
 19498 00000A74 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19499                                  OldVDInt19:
 19500 00000A75 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19501                                  
 19502                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19503                                  
 19504                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19505 00000A79 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19506                                  VDiskSig2:
 19507 00000A7C 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19508                                  
 19509                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19510                                  
 19511 00000A81 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19512 00000A84 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19513 00000A86 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19514 00000A87 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19515 00000A89 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19516 00000A8A 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19517 00000A8C 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19518 00000A8E FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19519 00000A8F 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19520 00000A91 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19521 00000A93 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19522 00000A95 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19523 00000A97 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19524                                  
 19525                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 19527                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19528                                  ;
 19529                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19530                                  ;
 19531                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19532                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19533                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19534                                  ;
 19535                                  ; Inputs : None
 19536                                  ;
 19537                                  ; Outputs : None
 19538                                  ;
 19539                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19540                                  ;
 19541                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19542                                  
 19543                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19544                                  
 19545                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19546 00000A99 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19547 00000A9B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19548                                  
 19549                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19550                                  
 19551                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19552 00000A9D A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19553                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19554 00000AA0 2EA3[750A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19555 00000AA4 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19556                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19557 00000AA7 2EA3[770A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19558                                  
 19559                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19560                                  
 19561 00000AAB B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19562                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19563                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19564 00000AAD BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19565 00000AB0 CD21                    	int	21h
 19566                                  
 19567                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19568                                  
 19569 00000AB2 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19570 00000AB3 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19571                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19572 00000AB5 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19573                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19574 00000ABC 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19575 00000AC3 40                      	inc	ax
 19576 00000AC4 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19577                                  
 19578                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19579                                  
 19580 00000AC6 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 19581                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 19582 00000AC7 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 19583 00000ACD A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 19584

 19586                                  
 19587                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)

 19590 00000AD6 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 19591 00000AD8 0E                      	push	cs
 19592 00000AD9 1F                      	pop	ds
 19593 00000ADA FC                      	cld
 19594 00000ADB F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 19595 00000ADD FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 19596                                  
 19597                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 19598                                  
 19599                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19600 00000ADE 57                      	push	di
 19601 00000ADF 06                      	push	es
 19602

 19604 00000AE3 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax

 19663                                  
 19664                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19665                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19666                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19667                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19668                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19669                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19670                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19671                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19672                                  ;								      ;I070
 19673                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19674                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19675                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19676                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19677                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19678                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19679                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19680                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19681                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19682                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19683                                  ;								      ;I070
 19684                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19685                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070

 19725                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 19726                                  ;
 19727                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 19728                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 19729                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 19730                                  ;		the offset.
 19731                                  ;
 19732                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 19733                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 19734                                  ;
 19735                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 19740 00000B70 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 19741 00000B72 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 19742 00000B75 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 19743 00000B78 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19744 00000B7A D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19745 00000B7C 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 19746 00000B7E 1E                      	push	ds
 19747                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 19748                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 19749                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19750 00000B7F B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 19751 00000B82 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19752 00000B84 893E[F508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 19753 00000B88 C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 19754 00000B8D 1F                      	pop	ds
 19755 00000B8E C3                      	retn

 20683                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20684                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20685                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20686                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20687                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20688                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20689                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20690                                  ;
 20691                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20692                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20693                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20694                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20695                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20696                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20697                                  ;
 20698                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20699                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20700                                  ;
 20701                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20702                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20703                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20704                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20705                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20706                                  ;
 20707                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20708                                  ;
 20709                                  ;			  none.
 20710                                  
 20711                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20712                                  ;
 20713                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20714                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20715                                  
 20716                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20717
