 20920                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20921                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20922                                  ;
 20923                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20924                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20925                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20926                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20927                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20928                                  ; program).
 20929                                  
 20930                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 20931                                  
 20932                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 20933                                  
 20934 00001040 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 20935                                  
 20936                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20937                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20938                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20939                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20940                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20941                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20942                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20943                                  ; carridge return.
 20944                                  
 20945                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 20946                                  ;character after =.
 20947                                  
 20948 00001041 06                      	push	es
 20949 00001042 1E                      	push	ds
 20950 00001043 07                      	pop	es
 20951 00001044 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 20952 00001045 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 20953                                  
 20954 00001047 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 20955 00001049 FC                      	cld
 20956 0000104A 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 20957 00001050 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 20958                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 20959 00001053 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 20960 00001054 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 20961 00001056 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 20962 00001058 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 20963                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 20964 0000105A AC                      	lodsb
 20965 0000105B 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 20966 0000105E 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 20967 00001060 7405                    	je	short done_installparm

 20969 00001064 47                      	inc	di
 20970 00001065 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm

 21066                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21067                                  
 21068                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21069                                  ;
 21070                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21071                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21072                                  ;
 21073                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21074                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21075                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21076                                  
 21077                                  ParaRound:
 21078 000010C0 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21079 000010C3 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21080 000010C5 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21081 000010C7 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21082 000010C9 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21083 000010CB C3                      	retn
 21084                                  
 21085                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21086                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21087                                  ;
 21088                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21089                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21090                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21091                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21092                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21093                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21094                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21095                                  ;
 21096                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21097                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21098                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21099                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21100                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21101                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21102                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21103                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21104                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21105                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21106                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21107                                  ;
 21108                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21109                                  
 21110                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21111                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21112                                  sysinit_base:				
 21113 000010CC 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21114 000010D1 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21115 000010D6 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21116 000010D8 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21117 000010DD 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21118 000010E2 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21119 000010E3 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21120 000010E4 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21121                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21122                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21123 000010E6 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21124 000010E9 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21125 000010EE 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21126                                  
 21127                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21128                                  
 21129 000010F0 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21130 000010F2 0E                      	push	cs
 21131 000010F3 1F                      	pop	ds
 21132 000010F4 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21133 000010F7 CD21                    	int	21h
 21134                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21135                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21136                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21137                                  _stall: 
 21138                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21139 000010F9 F4                      	hlt 
 21140                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21141                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21142 000010FA EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21143                                  
 21144                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21145 000010FC 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21146                                  
 21147                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21148                                  
 21149                                  sum_up:
 21150                                  
 21151                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21152                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21153                                  ;
 21154                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21155                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21156                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21157                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21158                                  ;
 21159                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21160                                  
 21161 00001101 1E                      	push	ds
 21162                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21163                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21164 00001102 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21165 00001106 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21166 00001108 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21167 0000110A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21168 0000110C 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21169                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21170 00001111 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21171 00001113 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21172                                  sum1:
 21173 00001115 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21174 00001117 46                      	inc	si
 21175 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 21176 00001119 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21177                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21178                                  sum_sys_code:
 21179                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21180 0000111B BE1A11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21181                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21182                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21183                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21184                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21185                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21186                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21187                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21188 0000111E B9[B038]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit

 21221                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21222                                  ;
 21223                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21224                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21225                                  ;
 21226                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21227                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.

 21229                                  ;
 21230                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21231                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.

 21254

 21277                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0

 21280 0000118F 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax

 21284                                  set_buff_2:

 21287 0000119E 2E800E[3414]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 21293                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21294                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21295                                  ;
 21296                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21297                                  ;
 21298                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21299                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21300                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 21302                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21303                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21304 000011A7 53                      	push	bx
 21305 000011A8 52                      	push	dx
 21306 000011A9 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21307 000011AD 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21308                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21309 000011B2 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21310                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21311                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21312                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21313 000011B5 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21314 000011B7 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21315 000011B9 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21316                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21317 000011BC CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21318 000011BE 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21319 000011C1 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21320 000011C3 BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21321                                  	;zf=1
 21322                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21323                                  	;zf=1
 21324 000011C6 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21325                                  got_hma:
 21326 000011CB 5A                      	pop	dx
 21327 000011CC 5B                      	pop	bx
 21328 000011CD C3                      	retn

 21358                                  ; ======================================================================
 21359                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21360                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21361                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21362                                  
 21363                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21364                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21365                                  ;
 21366                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21367                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21368                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21369                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21370                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21371                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21372                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21373                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21374                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21375                                  ;
 21376                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21377                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21378                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21379                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21380                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21381                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21382                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21383                                  ;	conditions:
 21384                                  ;
 21385                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21386                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21387                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21388                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21389                                  ;
 21390                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21391                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21392                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21393                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21394                                  ;
 21395                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21396                                  ;
 21397                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21398                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21399                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21400                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21401                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21402                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21403                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21404                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21405                                  ;
 21406                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21407                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21408                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21409                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21410                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21411                                  ;
 21412                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21413                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21414                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21415                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21416                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21417                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21418                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21419                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21420                                  ;
 21421                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21422                                  
 21423                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21424                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21425                                  
 21426                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21427                                  stackinit:
 21428 000011F6 50                      	push	ax
 21429 000011F7 1E                      	push	ds
 21430 000011F8 06                      	push	es
 21431 000011F9 53                      	push	bx
 21432 000011FA 51                      	push	cx
 21433 000011FB 52                      	push	dx
 21434 000011FC 57                      	push	di
 21435 000011FD 56                      	push	si
 21436 000011FE 55                      	push	bp
 21437                                  
 21438                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21439                                  
 21440                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21441                                  	; ds = cs
 21442 000011FF A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21443 00001202 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21444                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21445                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21446                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21447 00001204 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21448                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)

 22238 000013D4 7411                    	je	short int_xx_not_first
 22239                                  	
 22240 000013D6 81FA00F0                	cmp	dx,0F000h
 22241 000013DA 750B                    	jne	short int_xx_not_first
 22242                                  
 22243 000013DC 06                      	push	es
 22244                                  	;push	dx
 22245                                  	;mov	dx,0F000h
 22246 000013DD 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 22247 000013DF 263B1E01FF              	cmp	bx,[es:0FF01h]
 22248                                        	;pop	dx
 22249 000013E4 07                      	pop	es
 22250 000013E5 7401                    	je	short int_xx_first
 22251                                  
 22252                                  int_xx_not_first:
 22253 000013E7 F9                      	stc
 22254                                  int_xx_first:
 22255 000013E8 1F                      	pop	ds
 22256 000013E9 C3                      	retn
 22257                                  
 22258                                  ;%endif
 22259                                  
 22260                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22261                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22262                                  
 22263                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22264                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22265                                  
 22266                                  new_init_loop:
 22267                                  
 22268                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22269                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22270                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22271                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22272                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22273                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22274                                  
 22275 000013EA 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22276 000013ED 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22277 000013EF 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22278 000013F3 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22279                                  
 22280 000013F6 1E                      	push	ds
 22281                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22282                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22283                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22284 000013F7 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22285 000013FA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22286 000013FC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22287 000013FF 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22288 00001401 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22289 00001405 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22290 00001408 1F                      	pop	ds
 22291                                  
 22292 00001409 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22293 0000140C 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22294 00001410 C3                      	retn
 22295                                  
 22296                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22297                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22298                                  
 22299                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22300                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22301                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22302                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22303                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22304                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22305                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22306                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22307                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22308                                  
 22309                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22310                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22311                                  
 22312                                  setdevmark:
 22313                                  
 22314 00001411 06                      	push	es
 22315 00001412 51                      	push	cx
 22316                                  
 22317 00001413 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22318 00001418 2E890E[3214]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22319 0000141D 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22320                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22321                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22322 0000141F 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22323 00001423 41                      	inc	cx
 22324                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22325 00001424 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22326                                  
 22327 00001429 59                      	pop	cx
 22328 0000142A 07                      	pop	es
 22329 0000142B 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22330 00001430 C3                      	retn

 22531                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22532                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22533                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22534                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22535                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22536                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22537                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22538                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22539                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22540                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22541                                  
 22542                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22543                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22544 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22545 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22546 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22547                                  endstruc
 22548                                  
 22549                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 22550                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 22551                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 22552                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22553                                  
 22554                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22555                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22556                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED

 22558                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22559                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22560                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22561                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES

 22563                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22564                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES

 22566                                  
 22567                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22568                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22569 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22570 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22571 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22572                                  endstruc
 22573                                  
 22574                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22575                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22576                                  ;
 22577                                  ;
 22578                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22579                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22580                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22581                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22582                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22583                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22584                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22585                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22586                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22587                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22588                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22589                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22590                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22591                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22592                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22593                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22594                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22595                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22596                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22597                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22598                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22599                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22600                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22601                                  ;	   :
 22602                                  ;
 22603                                  ;Note:
 22604                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22605                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22606                                  ;
 22607                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22608                                  ;
 22609                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22610                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22611                                  ;
 22612                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22613                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22614                                  ;
 22615                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22616                                  ;
 22617                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22618                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22619                                  ;
 22620                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22621                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22622                                  ;
 22623                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22624                                  ;
 22625                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22626                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22627                                  ;
 22628                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22629                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22630                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22631                                  ;
 22632                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22633                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22634                                  ;
 22635                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22636                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22637                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22638                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22639                                  
 22640                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22641                                  
 22642                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22643                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22644                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22645                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22646                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22647                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22648                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22649                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22650                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22651                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22652                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22653                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22654                                  
 22655                                  ;**** Function flags
 22656                                  
 22657                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22658                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22659                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22660                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22661                                  
 22662                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22663                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22664 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22665 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22666 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22667 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22668 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22669 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22670                                  endstruc
 22671                                  
 22672                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22673                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22674                                  ;
 22675                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22676                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22677                                  ;	     +-
 22678                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22679                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22680                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22681                                  ;	     |	:
 22682                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22683                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22684                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22685                                  ;	     |	:
 22686                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22687                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22688                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22689                                  ;	     +-	:
 22690                                  ;
 22691                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22692                                  ;
 22693                                  ;Note:
 22694                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22695                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22696                                  ;
 22697                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22698                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22699                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22700                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22701                                  
 22702                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22703                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22704                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22705                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22706                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22707                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22708                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22709                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22710                                  
 22711                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22712 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22713 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22714 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22715 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22716 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22717                                  endstruc
 22718                                  
 22719                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22720                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22721                                  ;
 22722                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22723                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22724                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22725                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22726                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22727                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22728                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22729                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22730                                  ;
 22731                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22732                                  ;
 22733                                  ;            +-
 22734                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22735                                  ;	    | or
 22736                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22737                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22738                                  ;	    | or
 22739                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22740                                  ;	    | or
 22741                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22742                                  ;	    | or
 22743                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22744                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22745                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22746                                  ;	    | or
 22747                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22748                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22749                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22750                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22751                                  ;	    +-
 22752                                  ;
 22753                                  ;
 22754                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22755                                  ;      list.
 22756                                  ;
 22757                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22758                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22759                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22760                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22761                                  
 22762                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22763                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22764 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22765 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22766 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22767 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22768                                  endstruc

 22798                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22799                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 22883                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22884                                  ; SysParse;
 22885                                  ;
 22886                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22887                                  ;
 22888                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22889                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22890                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22891                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22892                                  ;
 22893                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22894                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22895                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22896                                  ;
 22897                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22898                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22899                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22900                                  ;
 22901                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22902                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22903                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22904                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22905                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22906                                  ;
 22907                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22908                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22909                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22910                                  ;
 22911                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22912                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22913                                  ;
 22914                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22915                                  ;
 22916                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22917                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22918                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22919                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22920                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22921                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22922                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22923                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22924                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22925                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22926                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22927                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22928                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22929                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22930                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22931                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22932                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22933                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22934                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22935                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22936                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22937                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22938                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22939                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22940                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22941                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22942                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22943                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22944                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22945                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22946                                  
 22947                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22948                                  
 22949                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22950                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22951                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22952                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22953                                  
 22954                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22955                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22956                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22957                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22958                                  ;
 22959                                  
 22960                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22961                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22962                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22963                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22964                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22965                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22966                                  
 22967                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22968                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22969                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22970                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22971                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22972                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22973                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22974                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22975                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22976                                  
 22977                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22978                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22979                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22980                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22981                                  ;	     segment.
 22982                                  
 22983                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 22984                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 22985                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 22986                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 22987                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 22988                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 22989                                  
 22990                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 22991                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 22992                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments

 23004                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.

 23091                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 23092                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change

 23099 00001516 2EC706[DB14]3B3D        	mov 	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+6], ';='

 23518                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23519                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23520                                  ;
 23521                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23522                                  ;
 23523                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23524                                  ;	    AL = type
 23525                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23526                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23527                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23528                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23529                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23530                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23531                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23532                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23533                                  ;
 23534                                  ; Output:   None
 23535                                  ;
 23536                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23537                                  ;
 23538                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23539                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23540

 23753                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 23754                                  ;
 23755                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 23756                                  ;
 23757                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 23758                                  ;
 23759                                  ; Output:   None
 23760                                  ;
 23761                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS
 23762                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23763                                  
 23764                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 23765 00001846 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23766 00001847 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23767                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 23768 00001848 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 23769 0000184B 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 23770 0000184D 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 23771                                  
 23772 0000184F 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 23773 00001851 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 23774                                  
 23775 00001853 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; if so, next is NULL ?
 23776 00001858 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 23777                                  
 23778 0000185A 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 23779 0000185E EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 23780                                  
 23781                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 23782 00001860 E81904                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 23783 00001863 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 23784                                  
 23785 00001865 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; if yes, skip trailing byte
 23786                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;
 23787 00001866 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si points to next byte
 23788 00001867 EBDF                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 23789                                  
 23790                                  _$P_RCOL_Exit:				;AN000;
 23791 00001869 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 23792 0000186A 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23793 0000186B C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 23795                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23796                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 23797                                  ;
 23798                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 23799                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 23800                                  ;
 23801                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 23802                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 23803                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 23804                                  ;
 23805                                  ; Output:   None
 23806                                  ;
 23807                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23808                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23809                                  
 23810                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 23811 0000186C 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23812 0000186D 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23813 0000186E 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 23814                                  
 23815                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 23816 00001870 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 23817 00001873 E80604                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 23818 00001876 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 23819                                  
 23820 00001878 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 23821 0000187A 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 23822                                  
 23823 0000187C E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 23824 0000187F 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 23825 00001882 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 23826                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;

 23934                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling

 24172                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24173                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24174                                  ;
 24175                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24176                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24177                                  ;
 24178                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24179                                  ;
 24180                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24181                                  ;
 24182                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24183                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24184                                  
 24185                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24186                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24187 000019D4 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24188 000019D5 2EF606[4714]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24189 000019DB 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24190                                  
 24191 000019DD 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24192 000019DE C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24193                                  
 24194                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24195 000019DF 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24196 000019E0 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24197                                  
 24198 000019E2 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24199 000019E3 C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24200                                  
 24201                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24202                                  _$P_0099Err: ; 14/08/2023
 24203 000019E4 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24204                                  _$P_0099Err2: ; 14/08/2023
 24205 000019E5 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24206                                  
 24207                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24208                                  ; _$P_0099;
 24209                                  ;
 24210                                  ; Function:  Make ASCII 0-9 to Binary 0-9
 24211                                  ;
 24212                                  ; Input:     AL = character code
 24213                                  ;
 24214                                  ; Output:    CY = 1 : AL is not number
 24215                                  ;	     CY = 0 : AL contains binary value
 24216                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24217

 24907                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24908                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24909                                  ;
 24910                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24911                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24912                                  ;
 24913                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24914                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24915                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24916                                  ;
 24917                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24918                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24919                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24920                                  
 24921                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24922                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24923                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24924                                  ;
 24925                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24926                                  
 24927                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24928                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24929                                  
 24930                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24931                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24932                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24933                                  	; 14/08/2023
 24934 00001C63 BD[5014]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 24935                                  
 24936                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24937 00001C66 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24938 00001C68 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24939                                  
 24940                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24941 00001C6A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24942 00001C6C 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24943                                  
 24944 00001C6E F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24945                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24946                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24947 00001C6F C3                      	retn
 24948                                  
 24949                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24950                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24951                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24952                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24953                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24954                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24955                                  
 24956                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24957                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24958 00001C70 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24959 00001C72 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24960                                  
 24961 00001C74 2E800E[4714]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24962                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24963                                  
 24964                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24965                                  	; cf=0
 24966                                  	;retn
 24967                                  
 24968                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24969                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24970                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24971 00001C7A F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24972                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24973                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24974 00001C7B C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24975                                  
 24976                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24977                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24978                                  ;
 24979                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24980                                  ;
 24981                                  ;  Input:
 24982                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24983                                  ;
 24984                                  ;  Output:
 24985                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24986                                  ;
 24987                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24988                                  ;
 24989                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24990                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24991                                  
 24992                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24993 00001C7C 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24994 00001C7D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24995 00001C7E 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24996                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24997                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24998                                  	; 14/08/2023
 24999 00001C7F 2E8B36[4414]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 25000 00001C84 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25001 00001C86 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25002 00001C88 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25003 00001C89 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25004 00001C8A 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25005 00001C8B 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25006 00001C8C 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25007 00001C8D 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25008 00001C8E 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25009                                  	; si = 0 ; 14/08/2023
 25010                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25011 00001C8F 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 25012 00001C91 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25013 00001C94 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25014                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25015 00001C96 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25016 00001C98 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25017 00001C9A 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25018 00001C9B 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25019 00001C9C 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25020 00001C9D 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25021 00001C9E 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25022 00001C9F 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25023 00001CA0 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25024 00001CA1 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25025                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25026 00001CA3 2E8936[4214]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25027 00001CA8 2E891E[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25028                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25029                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25030                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25031                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25032 00001CAD 2EC536[4214]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25033                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25034 00001CB2 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25035 00001CB5 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25036 00001CB7 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25037 00001CB9 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25038 00001CBB 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25039 00001CBE 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25040 00001CC0 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25041 00001CC1 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25042                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25043 00001CC3 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25044 00001CC4 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25045                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25046 00001CC5 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25047                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25048                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25049                                  	; cf=0
 25050                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25051                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25052 00001CC7 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25053 00001CC8 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
