 25067                                  struc p_parms
 25068 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 25069 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 25070 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 25071 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 25072                                  .size:
 25073                                  endstruc
 25074                                  
 25075                                  struc p_pos
 25076 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 25077 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 25078 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 25079                                  
 25080                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 25081                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 25082                                  
 25083 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list
 25084 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 25085                                  .size:
 25086                                  endstruc
 25087                                  
 25088                                  struc	p_range
 25089 00000000 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; range definition
 25090 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 25091 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 25092 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 25093 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 25094                                  .size:
 25095                                  endstruc

 25611                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25612                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25613                                  
 25614                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25615                                  ;
 25616                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25617                                  ;
 25618                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25619                                  ;
 25620                                  ;   Modification log:
 25621                                  ;
 25622                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25623                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25624                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25625                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25626                                  ;
 25627                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25628                                  ;
 25629                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25630                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25631                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25632                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25633                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25634                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25635                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25636                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25637                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25638                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25639                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25640                                  ;
 25641                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25642                                  
 25643                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25644                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25645                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25646                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25647                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25648                                  
 25649                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25650                                  
 25651                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25652                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25653                                  
 25654                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25655                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25656                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25657                                  
 25658                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25659                                  ;
 25660                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25661                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25662                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25663                                  ;	           line.
 25664                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25665                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25666                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25667                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25668                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25669                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25670                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25671                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25672                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25673                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25674                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25675                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25676                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25677                                  ;	           for details).
 25678                                  
 25679                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25680                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25681                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25682                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25683                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25684                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25685                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25686                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25687                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25688                                  
 25689                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25690                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25691                                  
 25692                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25693                                  
 25694                                  %endif
 25695                                  
 25696                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****

 25709 00001EB4 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver

 25749                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25750                                  ;
 25751                                  ; procedure : doconf
 25752                                  ;
 25753                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 25754                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 25755                                  ;
 25756                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25757                                  
 25758                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25759                                  doconf:
 25760 00001EE1 0E                      	push	cs
 25761 00001EE2 1F                      	pop	ds
 25762                                  
 25763 00001EE3 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 25764                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 25765 00001EE6 CD21                    	int	21h
 25766 00001EE8 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 25767                                  
 25768                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25769                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25770                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 25771                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 25772                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25773                                  
 25774 00001EEC BA[C433]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 25775 00001EEF B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 25776                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 25777 00001EF2 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25778 00001EF3 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25779 00001EF5 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 25780                                  
 25781                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25782                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25783                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 25784                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 25785                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 25786 00001EF7 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 25787 00001EFC C3                      	retn
 25788                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 25789 00001EFD 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 25790 00001EFF 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25791 00001F01 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25792                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 25793 00001F03 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 25794 00001F06 CD21                    	int	21h
 25795 00001F08 A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 25796                                  
 25797 00001F0B 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25798                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 25799 00001F0D B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 25800 00001F10 CD21                    	int	21h
 25801                                  
 25802                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25803                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25804 00001F12 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 25805                                  
 25806 00001F16 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 25807 00001F19 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25808 00001F1C E8A1F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25809 00001F1F 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25810                                  
 25811                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25812                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25813                                  ;;
 25814                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25815                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25816                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25817                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25818                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25819                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25820                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25821                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25822                                  ;;
 25823                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25824                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25825                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25826                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25827                                  
 25828 00001F21 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25829                                  	
 25830                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25831                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 25832                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25833 00001F24 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 25834 00001F28 E8ABEC                  	call    TempCDS 
 25835                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25836                                  	; ds <> cs 
 25837 00001F2B 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 25838                                   
 25839 00001F30 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 25840 00001F32 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25841                                  
 25842 00001F34 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25843 00001F36 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25844 00001F3B B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25845                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 25846 00001F3D F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25847 00001F3E CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25848 00001F40 9C                      	pushf
 25849                                  
 25850                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25851                                  
 25852 00001F41 50                      	push	ax
 25853 00001F42 57                      	push	di
 25854 00001F43 51                      	push	cx
 25855 00001F44 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25856 00001F46 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25857 00001F48 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25858 00001F4A F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25859 00001F4C 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25860                                  
 25861                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25862                                  
 25863 00001F4E 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25864                                  
 25865                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25866                                  
 25867                                  puteol:
 25868 00001F4F B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25869 00001F51 AA                      	stosb
 25870 00001F52 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25871 00001F54 AA                      	stosb
 25872 00001F55 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 25873                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25874                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 25875                                  
 25876                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 25877                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25878 00001F57 0E                      	push	cs
 25879 00001F58 1F                      	pop	ds
 25880                                  
 25881 00001F59 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 25882                                  
 25883 00001F5D 59                      	pop	cx
 25884 00001F5E 5F                      	pop	di
 25885 00001F5F 58                      	pop	ax
 25886                                  
 25887                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25888                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25889                                  	;push	cs
 25890                                  	;pop	ds
 25891                                  
 25892 00001F60 50                      	push	ax
 25893                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 25894 00001F61 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 25895 00001F63 CD21                    	int	21h
 25896 00001F65 58                      	pop	ax
 25897 00001F66 9D                      	popf
 25898 00001F67 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25899 00001F69 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 25900 00001F6B 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 25901                                  conferr:
 25902 00001F6D BA[C433]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 25903 00001F70 E8A813                  	call	badfil
 25904                                  endconv:
 25905 00001F73 C3                      	retn
 25906                                  
 25907                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25908                                  ;
 25909                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25910                                  ;
 25911                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 25912                                  ;
 25913                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25914                                  
 25915                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25916                                  multi_pass:
 25917 00001F74 0E                      	push	cs
 25918 00001F75 1F                      	pop	ds
 25919                                  
 25920 00001F76 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 25921                                  ;jae_endconv:
 25922 00001F7B 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 25923                                  
 25924                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 25925                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25926 00001F7D FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25927 00001F81 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25928                                  
 25929 00001F82 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]

 25963                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25964                                  
 25965                                          push    ax                      ;
 25966                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25967                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25968                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25969                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25970                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25971                                          pop     ax
 25972                                  ;
 25973                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25974                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25975                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25976                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25977                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25978                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25979                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25980                                  ;   spot.
 25981                                  ;
 25982                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25983                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25984                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25985                                  ;   retrieved.
 25986                                  ;
 25987                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25988                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25989                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25990                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25991                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 25992                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 25993                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25994                                  final:                                  ;
 25995                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 25996                                  not_final:                              ;
 25997                                  ;endif
 25998                                  
 25999                                  %endif

 26167                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26168                                  ;									      *
 26169                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26170                                  ;									      *
 26171                                  ; input :								      *
 26172                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26173                                  ; output:								      *
 26174                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26175                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26176                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26177                                  ;									      *
 26178                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26179                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26180                                  ; logic:								      *
 26181                                  ; {									      *
 26182                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26183                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26184                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26185                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26186                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26187                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26188                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26189                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26190                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26191                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26192                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26193                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26194                                  ;	};								      *
 26195                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26196                                  ; };									      *
 26197                                  ;									      *
 26198                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26199                                  
 26200                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26201                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)

 26209                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26210                                  ;;endif

 26287                                  ; break command
 26288                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26289                                  
 26290                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26291                                  ;									    *
 26292                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26293                                  ;									    *
 26294                                  ; input :								    *
 26295                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26296                                  ; output:								    *
 26297                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 26298                                  ;									    *
 26299                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 26300                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 26301                                  ; logic:								    *
 26302                                  ; {									    *
 26303                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 26304                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 26305                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 26306                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26307                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26308                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 26309                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 26310                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26311                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 26312                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 26313                                  ;	};								    *
 26314                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 26315                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 26316                                  ; };									    *
 26317                                  ;									    *
 26318                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26319                                  
 26320                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26321                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 26322                                  tryc:
 26323 00002076 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 26324 00002079 7534                    	jne	short trym
 26325                                  
 26326                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26327                                  ;;ifdef MULTI_CONFIG
 26328                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26329                                  ;       jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26330                                  ;;endif
 26331 0000207B BF[1C1D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 26332 0000207E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26333                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26334                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26335                                  do22:
 26336 00002080 E82506                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26337 00002083 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 26338                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 26339                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 26340                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26341                                  ;sr22:
 26342                                  	;jmp	coff
 26343                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26344 00002085 E99E05                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 26345                                  if22:
 26346 00002088 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 26347 0000208B 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 26348                                  
 26349                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 26350 0000208D 803E[151D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 26351 00002092 7507                    	jne	short if26
 26352                                  
 26353 00002094 C606[411D]01            	mov	byte [p_ctrl_break],1	; turn it on
 26354                                  	;jmp	short en26
 26355                                  	; 31/12/2022

 26372                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26373                                  ; multitrack command
 26374                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26375                                  
 26376                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26377                                  ;									      *
 26378                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 26379                                  ;									      *
 26380                                  ; input :								      *
 26381                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26382                                  ; output:								      *
 26383                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 26384                                  ;									      *
 26385                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26386                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26387                                  ; logic:								      *
 26388                                  ; {									      *
 26389                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 26390                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26391                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26392                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26393                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26394                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 26395                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 26396                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 26397                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 26398                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 26399                                  ;	};								      *
 26400                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 26401                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *
 26402                                  ;									      *
 26403                                  ; };									      *
 26404                                  ;									      *

 26849                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 26850                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 26851                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 26852                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 26853                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the
 26854                                  ;	value we pass it, we'll temporarily stick our value into
 26855                                  ;	DOS DATA while we're initializing the device drivers.
 26856                                  ;
 26857                                  ;	Note that this will make it impossible for this device
 26858                                  ;	driver to access the DblSpace drive letters, whether
 26859                                  ;	they are swapped-hosts or unswapped compressed drives,

 27713                                  
 27714                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27715                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27716                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27717                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27718                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27719                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27720                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27721                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27722                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27723                                  
 27724                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27725                                  ;									  *
 27726                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27727                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27728                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27729                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27730                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27731                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27732                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27733                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27734                                  ; input :								  *
 27735                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27736                                  ; output:								  *
 27737                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27738                                  ;									  *
 27739                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27740                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27741                                  ; logic:								  *
 27742                                  ; {									  *
 27743                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27744                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27745                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27746                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27747                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27748                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27749                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27750                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27751                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27752                                  ;	     }								  *
 27753                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27754                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27755                                  ;	};								  *
 27756                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27757                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27758                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27759                                  ; };									  *
 27760                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27761                                  
 27762                                  tryk:
 27763                                          ;if      stacksw
 27764

 28429                                  sysinit_parse:
 28430                                  
 28431                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28432                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28433                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28434                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28435                                  ;
 28436                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28437                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28438                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28439                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28440                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28441                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28442                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28443                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28444                                  ;	 procedure.
 28445                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28446                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28447                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28448                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28449                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 28450                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28451                                  
 28452                                  	; 24/10/2022

 28663                                  ; procedure : showlinenum
 28664                                  ;
 28665                                  ; convert the binary linecount to decimal ascii string in showcount
 28666                                  ; and display showcount at the current curser position.
 28667                                  ; in.) linecount
 28668                                  ;
 28669                                  ; out) the number is printed.

 28686                                  	;push	cs
 28687                                  	;pop	ds

 28689 00002720 BF[3103]                	mov	di,showcount+4	; di -> the least significant decimal field.
 28690 00002723 B90A00                  	mov	cx,10		; decimal divide factor
 28691                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:linecount]
 28692                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28693 00002726 A1[2B03]                	mov	ax,[linecount]
 28694                                  sln_loop:
 28695                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28696 00002729 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; < 10 ?
 28697                                  	;cmp	ax,10		; < 10?
 28698 0000272B 720C                    	jb	short sln_last
 28699                                  
 28700 0000272D 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 28701 0000272F F7F1                    	div	cx	; cx = 10
 28702 00002731 80CA30                  	or	dl,30h		; add "0" (= 30h) to make it an ascii.
 28703 00002734 8815                    	mov	[di],dl
 28704 00002736 4F                      	dec	di
 28705 00002737 EBF0                    	jmp	short sln_loop
 28706                                  
 28707                                  sln_last:

 28709 0000273B 8805                    	mov	[di],al
 28710 0000273D 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28711 0000273F E8050C                  	call	print		; show it.
 28712 00002742 5F                      	pop	di

 28715 00002743 07                      	pop	es

 28774                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28775                                  ;
 28776                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28777                                  ;
 28778                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28779                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28780                                  ;
 28781                                  ;	Output : none
 28782                                  ;
 28783                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28784                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28785                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28786                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28787                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28788                                  ;
 28789                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28790                                  
 28791                                  LieInt12Mem:
 28792                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28793                                  	; ds = cs
 28794 00002768 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 28795                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 28796                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28797 0000276B E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28798 0000276E 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28799                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28800                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28801                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28802                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28803                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28804                                  	; ds = cs
 28805 00002770 803E[CB1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28806 00002775 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28807 00002777 A1[B21E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28808                                  lim_set:
 28809                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28810                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28811                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 28812                                  ;limx:
 28813                                  	;retn
 28814                                  	
 28815                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 28816                                  
 28817                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28818                                  ;
 28819                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28820                                  ;
 28821                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28822                                  ;	Output : none
 28823                                  ;
 28824                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28825                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28826                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28827                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28828                                  ;
 28829                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28830                                  
 28831                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28832                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28833 0000277A 1E                      	push	ds
 28834 0000277B BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28835 0000277E 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28836 00002780 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28837 00002784 2E891E[CF1E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28838 00002789 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28839 0000278B D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28840 0000278D A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28841 00002790 2EC606[CE1E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28842 00002796 1F                      	pop	ds
 28843                                  ;limx:
 28844 00002797 C3                      	retn
 28845                                  
 28846                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28847                                  ;
 28848                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28849                                  ;
 28850                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28851                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28852                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28853                                  ;
 28854                                  ;	Output : none
 28855                                  ;
 28856                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 28857                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28858                                  ;
 28859                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28860                                  
 28861                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28862                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28863                                  	; ds = cs
 28864 00002798 803E[CE1E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28865                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 28866                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 28867                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28868 0000279D 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28869                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28870 0000279F B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28871 000027A2 8826[CE1E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28872                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28873                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28874 000027A6 1E                      	push	ds
 28875                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28876 000027A7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28877 000027A9 2EA1[CF1E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28878 000027AD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28879 000027B0 1F                      	pop	ds
 28880                                  timx:
 28881 000027B1 C3                      	retn
 28882                                  
 28883                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28884                                  ;
 28885                                  ; procedure : IsIt3Com?
 28886                                  ;
 28887                                  ;	Input : DevEntry = Seg:0 of device driver
 28888                                  ;	Output : Zero flag set if device name is 'PROTMAN$'
 28889                                  ;		 else Zero flag is reset
 28890                                  ;
 28891                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28892                                  
 28893                                  IsIt3Com:
 28894                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28895                                  	; ds = cs
 28896 000027B2 1E                      	push	ds
 28897 000027B3 06                      	push	es
 28898 000027B4 56                      	push	si
 28899                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28900 000027B5 C536[B41E]              	lds	si,[DevEntry]
 28901                                  	;lds	si,[cs:DevEntry]	; ptr to device header
 28902 000027B9 83C60A                  	add	si,SYSDEV.NAME ; 10 	; ptr device name
 28903 000027BC 0E                      	push	cs
 28904 000027BD 07                      	pop	es
 28905 000027BE BF[D11E]                	mov	di,ThreeComName
 28906 000027C1 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; name length
 28907 000027C4 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 28908 000027C6 5E                      	pop	si
 28909 000027C7 07                      	pop	es
 28910 000027C8 1F                      	pop	ds
 28911 000027C9 C3                      	retn
 28912

 28921 000027D1 2E8B1E[A302]            	mov	bx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]
 28922                                  	;mov	[2],bx

 28931                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 28933                                  %if 0
 28934                                  
 28935                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 28936                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 28937                                  
 28938                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28939                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 28940                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28941                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28942                                  
 28943                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28944                                  ;
 28945                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 28946                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 28947                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 28948                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 28949                                  ;
 28950                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 28951                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 28952                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 28953                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 28954                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 28955                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 28956                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 28957                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 28958                                  ; available during the load.
 28959                                  ;
 28960                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 28961                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 28962                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 28963                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 28964                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 28965                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 28966                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 28967                                  ;
 28968                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 28969                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 28970                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 28971                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 28972                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 28973                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 28974                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 28975                                  ;
 28976                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28977                                  
 28978                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 28979                                  
 28980                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 28981                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 28982                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 28983                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 28984                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 28985                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 28986                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 28987                                  
 28988                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 28989                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 28990                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 28991                                  
 28992                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28993                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 28994                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28995                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 28996                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 28997                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 28998                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 28999                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29000                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29001                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29002                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29003                                  
 29004                                  InitVar:
 29005                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29006                                  	push	ax
 29007                                  	push	cx
 29008                                  	push	di
 29009                                  	push	es
 29010                                  
 29011                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29012                                  	push	cs
 29013                                  	pop	es
 29014                                  
 29015                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29016                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29017                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29018                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29019                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29020                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29021                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29022                                  
 29023                                  	cld
 29024                                  
 29025                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29026                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29027                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29028                                  
 29029                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29030                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29031                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29032                                  
 29033                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29034                                  
 29035                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29036                                  	pop	es
 29037                                  	pop	di
 29038                                  	pop	cx
 29039                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29040                                  
 29041                                  	retn
 29042                                  
 29043                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29044                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29045                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29046                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29047                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29048                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29049                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29050                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29051                                  
 29052                                  FixMem:
 29053                                  	push	ax
 29054                                  	push	bx
 29055                                  	push	cx
 29056                                  	push	dx
 29057                                  	push	es
 29058                                  
 29059                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29060                                  
 29061                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29062                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29063                                  
 29064                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29065                                  
 29066                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29067                                  
 29068                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29069                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29070                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29071                                  
 29072                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29073                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29074                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29075                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29076                                  
 29077                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29078                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29079                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29080                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29081                                  
 29082                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29083                                  
 29084                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29085                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29086                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29087                                  
 29088                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29089                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29090                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29091                                  	inc	bx
 29092                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29093                                  
 29094                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29095                                  
 29096                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29097                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29098                                  
 29099                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29100                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29101                                  	inc	bx
 29102                                  	mov	es,bx
 29103                                  
 29104                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29105                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29106                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29107                                  fmX:	
 29108                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29109                                  
 29110                                  	pop	es
 29111                                  	pop	dx
 29112                                  	pop	cx
 29113                                  	pop	bx
 29114                                  	pop	ax
 29115                                  
 29116                                  	retn
 29117                                  
 29118                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29119                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29120                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29121                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29122                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29123                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29124                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29125                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29126                                  
 29127                                  fm_link:
 29128                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29129                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29130                                  
 29131                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29132                                  	;
 29133                                  	;push	es
 29134                                  	;push	cs
 29135                                  	;pop	es
 29136                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29137                                  	;pop	es
 29138                                  	
 29139                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29140                                  
 29141                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29142                                  	mov	bx,1
 29143                                  	int	21h
 29144                                  	retn
 29145                                  
 29146                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29147                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29148                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29149                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29150                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29151                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29152                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29153                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29154                                  
 29155                                  fm_unlink:
 29156                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29157                                  	
 29158                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29159                                  	;
 29160                                  	;push	ds
 29161                                  	;push	cs
 29162                                  	;pop	ds
 29163                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29164                                  	;pop	ds
 29165                                  	
 29166                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29167                                  
 29168                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29169                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29170                                  	retn
 29171                                  
 29172                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29173                                  
 29174                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29175                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29176                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29177                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29178                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29179                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29180                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29181                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29182                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29183                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29184                                  ;
 29185                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29186                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29187                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29188                                  ;
 29189                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29190                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29191                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29192                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29193                                  ;
 29194                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29195                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29196                                  ;
 29197                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29198                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29199                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29200                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29201                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29202                                  ;     lh
 29203                                  ;     /l
 29204                                  ;     1
 29205                                  ;     1000
 29206                                  ;     2
 29207                                  ;     print
 29208                                  ;     /d
 29209                                  ;     :lpt2
 29210                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29211                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29212                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29213                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29214                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29215                                  ; for:
 29216                                  ;    Each /L
 29217                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29218                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29219                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29220                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29221                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29222                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29223                                  
 29224                                  ParseVar:
 29225                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29226                                  	push	di
 29227                                  	push	ds
 29228                                  	push	es
 29229                                  
 29230                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29231                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29232                                  	cld
 29233                                  
 29234                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29235                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29236                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29237                                  
 29238                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29239                                  	call	isWhite
 29240                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29241                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29242                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29243                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29244                                  
 29245                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29246                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29247                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29248                                  
 29249                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29250                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29251                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29252                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29253                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29254                                  	jne	short pv30
 29255                                  
 29256                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29257                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29258                                  
 29259                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29260                                  	;
 29261                                  	;push	es
 29262                                  	;push	cs
 29263                                  	;pop	es
 29264                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29265                                  	;pop	es
 29266                                  
 29267                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29268                                  
 29269                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29270                                  
 29271                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29272                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29273                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29274                                  
 29275                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29276                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29277                                  
 29278                                  	call	parseL
 29279                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29280                                  
 29281                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29282                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29283                                  
 29284                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29285                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29286                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29287                                  	dec	si
 29288                                  	stc
 29289                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29290                                  	pop	es
 29291                                  	pop	ds
 29292                                  	pop	di
 29293                                  	retn
 29294
