 29295                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29296                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29297                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29298                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29299                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29300                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29301                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29302                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29303                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29304                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29305                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29306                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29307                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29308                                  
 29309                                  parseL:
 29310                                  	lodsb
 29311                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29312                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29313                                  
 29314                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29315                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29316                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29317                                  
 29318                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29319                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29320                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29321                                  
 29322                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29323                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29324                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29325                                  
 29326                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29327                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29328                                  
 29329                                  	lodsb
 29330                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29331                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29332                                  
 29333                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29334                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29335                                  
 29336                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29337                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29338                                  
 29339                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29340                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29341                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29342                                  
 29343                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29344                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29345                                  
 29346                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29347                                  
 29348                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29349                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29350                                  
 29351                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29352                                  
 29353                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29354                                  
 29355                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29356                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29357                                  
 29358                                  	lodsb
 29359                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29360                                  	je	short pl10	;
 29361                                  
 29362                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29363                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29364                                  
 29365                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29366                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29367                                  
 29368                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29369                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29370                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29371                                  plE1:	
 29372                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29373                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29374                                  	dec	si
 29375                                  	stc
 29376                                  	retn
 29377                                  
 29378                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29379                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29380                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29381                                  	; cf=1
 29382                                  	;stc
 29383                                  	retn
 29384                                  plSwX:	
 29385                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29386                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29387                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29388                                  	; cf=0
 29389                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29390                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29391                                  
 29392                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29393                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29394                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29395                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29396                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29397                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29398                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29399                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29400                                  
 29401                                  ;incArgc:
 29402                                  	;push	ax
 29403                                  
 29404                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 29405                                  
 29406                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 29407                                  
 29408                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 29409                                  
 29410                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 29411                                  
 29412                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 29413                                  
 29414                                  	;pop	ax
 29415                                  	;retn
 29416                                  
 29417                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29418                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29419                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29420                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29421                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29422                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29423                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29424                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29425                                  
 29426                                  isEOL:
 29427                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29428                                  	je	short ieX
 29429                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29430                                  	je	short ieX
 29431                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29432                                  ieX:	
 29433                                  	retn
 29434                                  
 29435                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29436                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29437                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29438                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29439                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29440                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29441                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29442                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29443                                  
 29444                                  isWhite:
 29445                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29446                                  	je	short iwX
 29447                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29448                                  	je	short iwX
 29449                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29450                                  iwX:	
 29451                                  	retn
 29452                                  
 29453                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29454                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 29455                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29456                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 29457                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29458                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29459                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29460                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29461                                  
 29462                                  unMarkUMB:
 29463                                  	push	ax
 29464                                  	push	bx
 29465                                  	push	di
 29466                                  	push	es
 29467                                  
 29468                                  	push	cs
 29469                                  	pop	es
 29470                                  
 29471                                  	xor	ah,ah
 29472                                  	mov	bx,ax
 29473                                  
 29474                                  	; 19/04/2019
 29475                                  	
 29476                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 29477                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 29478                                  
 29479                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 29480                                  	jne	short umu10
 29481                                  
 29482                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 29483                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 29484                                  umu10:	
 29485                                  	pop	es
 29486                                  	pop	di
 29487                                  	pop	bx
 29488                                  	pop	ax
 29489                                  	retn
 29490                                  
 29491                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29492                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29493                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29494                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29495                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29496                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29497                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29498                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29499                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29500                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29501                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29502                                  
 29503                                  stowUMB:
 29504                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29505                                  	jb	short su10
 29506                                  	stc
 29507                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29508                                  su10:	
 29509                                  	push	bx
 29510                                  	push	di
 29511                                  	push	si
 29512                                  	push	ds
 29513                                  	push	es
 29514                                  	push	cs
 29515                                  	pop	es
 29516                                  	push	cs
 29517                                  	pop	ds
 29518                                  	
 29519                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 29520                                  	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 29521                                  	jne	short su20
 29522                                  	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29523                                  su20:	
 29524                                  	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 29525                                  	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 29526                                  
 29527                                  	mov	bl,al
 29528                                  	xor	bh,bh
 29529                                  	mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 29530                                  
 29531                                  	xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29532                                  
 29533                                  	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 29534                                  	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 29535                                  
 29536                                  	stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 29537                                  su30:	
 29538                                  	pop	es
 29539                                  	pop	ds
 29540                                  	pop	si
 29541                                  	pop	di
 29542                                  	pop	bx
 29543                                  	retn
 29544                                  
 29545                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29546                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 29547                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29548                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 29549                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29550                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29551                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29552                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29553                                  
 29554                                  ; 13/05/2019
 29555                                  
 29556                                  stowSiz:
 29557                                  	push	bx
 29558                                  	;push	di ; ?
 29559                                  	push	es
 29560                                  
 29561                                  	push	cs
 29562                                  	pop	es	
 29563                                  
 29564                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 29565                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 29566                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 29567                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 29568                                  	
 29569                                  	pop	es
 29570                                  	;pop	di ; ?
 29571                                  	pop	bx
 29572                                  
 29573                                  	retn
 29574                                  
 29575                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29576                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 29577                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 29578                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 29579                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 29580                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29581                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 29582                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 29583                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 29584                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 29585                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29586                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29587                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29588                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29589                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29590                                  
 29591                                  gnradix:
 29592                                  	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 29593                                  
 29594                                  toDigit:
 29595                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29596                                  	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 29597                                  
 29598                                  toDigit_hex:
 29599                                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 29600                                  	jb	short td10
 29601                                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 29602                                  	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 29603                                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 29604                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29605                                  	retn
 29606                                  td10:	
 29607                                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 29608                                  	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 29609                                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 29610                                  	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 29611                                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 29612                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29613                                  	retn
 29614                                  toDigit_dec:
 29615                                  td20:	
 29616                                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 29617                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 29618                                  	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 29619                                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 29620                                  	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 29621                                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 29622                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29623                                  	retn
 29624                                  tdE:	
 29625                                  	stc
 29626                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 29627                                  	retn
 29628                                  
 29629                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29630                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 29631                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29632                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 29633                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 29634                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 29635                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 29636                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29637                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29638                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29639                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29640                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29641                                  
 29642                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29643                                  
 29644                                  GetXNum:
 29645                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 29646                                  	push	bx
 29647                                  	push	cx
 29648                                  	push	ds
 29649                                  
 29650                                  	cld
 29651                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29652                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29653                                  	xor	cx,cx
 29654                                  	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 29655                                  
 29656                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 29657                                  
 29658                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 29659                                  	;call	toDigit
 29660                                  	call	toDigit_dec
 29661                                  	jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 29662                                  
 29663                                  	or	cl,cl
 29664                                  	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 29665                                  	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 29666                                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 29667                                  	je	short gxn10
 29668                                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 29669                                  	jne	short gxn20
 29670                                  
 29671                                  gxn10:	
 29672                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 29673                                  	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 29674                                  	inc	si
 29675                                  
 29676                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29677                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 29678                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 29679                                  ;        BX    = 0
 29680                                  ;        CH    = 0
 29681                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29682                                  
 29683                                  gxn20:	
 29684                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 29685                                  	inc	si
 29686                                  
 29687                                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 29688                                  	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 29689                                  
 29690                                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 29691                                  	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 29692                                  
 29693                                  	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 29694                                  	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 29695                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 29696                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 29697                                  	jnc	short gxn20
 29698                                  gxnE:	
 29699                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 29700                                  	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 29701                                  gxnQ:	
 29702                                  	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 29703                                  	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 29704                                  gxnX:	
 29705                                  	pop	ds
 29706                                  	pop	cx
 29707                                  	pop	bx
 29708                                  	retn
 29709                                  
 29710                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29711                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 29712                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29713                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 29714                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 29715                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 29716                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29717                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29718                                  
 29719                                  mul32:
 29720                                  	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29721                                  	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29722                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29723                                  	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 29724                                  
 29725                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29726                                  	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29727                                  
 29728                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29729                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29730                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29731                                  	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29732                                  	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29733                                  	retn
 29734                                  m32E:	
 29735                                  	pop	ax
 29736                                  	retn
 29737                                  
 29738                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29739                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 29740                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29741                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 29742                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 29743                                  ; ERROR:   None
 29744                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29745                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29746                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 29747                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 29748                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29749                                  
 29750                                  toPara:
 29751                                  	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 29752                                  
 29753                                  	mov	cl,4		;
 29754                                  	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 29755                                  	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 29756                                  	mov	cl,12
 29757                                  	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 29758                                  	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 29759                                  
 29760                                  	pop	cx
 29761                                  	retn
 29762                                  
 29763                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29764                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 29765                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29766                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 29767                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 29768                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 29769                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29770                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29771                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 29772                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 29773                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 29774                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 29775                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29776                                  
 29777                                  UmbHead:
 29778                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 29779                                  
 29780                                  	;push	si ; ?
 29781                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 29782                                  	;push	es
 29783                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 29784                                  
 29785                                  	; 09/04/2019
 29786                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 29787                                  
 29788                                  	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 29789                                  	int	21h
 29790                                  
 29791                                  	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 29792                                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 29793                                  	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 29794                                  
 29795                                  	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 29796                                  	;jmp	short uhX
 29797                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29798                                  	retn
 29799                                  uhE:	
 29800                                  	stc
 29801                                  uhX:	
 29802                                  	;pop	bx ; *
 29803                                  	;pop	es
 29804                                  	;pop	ds ; ?
 29805                                  	;pop	si ; ?
 29806                                  	retn
 29807                                  
 29808                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29809                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 29810                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29811                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 29812                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 29813                                  ; USES:   Flags
 29814                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29815                                  
 29816                                  isSysMCB:
 29817                                  	;push	ax
 29818                                  
 29819                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 29820                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 29821                                  	;je	short ism10
 29822                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 29823                                  	;;je	short ism10
 29824                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 29825                                  	;jne	short ismX
 29826                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 29827                                  	jne	short ismX 
 29828                                  ism10:	
 29829                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 29830                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 29831                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 29832                                  ismX:	
 29833                                  	;pop	ax
 29834                                  	retn
 29835                                  
 29836                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29837                                  
 29838                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29839                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 29840                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29841                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 29842                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 29843                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 29844                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29845                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29846                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 29847                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 29848                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 29849                                  ;      ...
 29850                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 29851                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29852                                  
 29853                                  AddrToUmb:
 29854                                  	push	cx
 29855                                  	push	dx
 29856                                  	push	es
 29857                                  
 29858                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 29859                                  
 29860                                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 29861                                  	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 29862                                  
 29863                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29864                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 29865                                  	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 29866                                  
 29867                                  	; 22/07/2023
 29868                                  atu10:
 29869                                  	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 14/08/2023
 29870                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 29871                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 29872                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 29873                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 29874                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 29875                                  
 29876                                  ;atu10:	
 29877                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 14/08/2023
 29878                                          cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 29879                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 29880                                  
 29881                                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 29882                                  	jnz	short atu20
 29883                                  
 29884                                  	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 29885                                  atu20:	
 29886                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 29887                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 29888                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29889                                  	; ax = es
 29890                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 29891                                  	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29892                                  	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 29893                                  	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 29894                                  
 29895                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 29896                                  
 29897                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 29898                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 29899                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29900                                  	inc	ax
 29901                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29902                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 29903                                  	jmp	short atu10
 29904                                  
 29905                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29906                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 29907                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 29908                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29909                                  
 29910                                  atu30:	
 29911                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29912                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 29913                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 29914                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 29915                                  	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 29916                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 29917                                  atuE:	
 29918                                  	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 29919                                  	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 29920                                  atuX:	
 29921                                  	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 29922                                  	
 29923                                  	pop	es	
 29924                                  	pop	dx
 29925                                  	pop	cx
 29926                                  	retn
 29927                                  
 29928                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29929                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 29930                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 29931                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 29932                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 29933                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29934                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 29935                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 29936                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29937                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29938                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29939                                  
 29940                                  convUMB:
 29941                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29942                                  	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 29943                                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 29944                                  ;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 29945                                  	;jne	short cu10
 29946                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 29947                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29948                                  	inc	ax
 29949                                  	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 29950                                  	dec	ax
 29951                                  cu10:	
 29952                                  	retn
 29953                                  
 29954                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29955                                  ;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 29956                                  ;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 29957                                  ; of the usual HIGH_FIRST.  See the code.
 29958                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29959                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 29960                                  ; EXIT:   None
 29961                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29962                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29963                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29964                                  
 29965                                  setUMBs:
 29966                                  	push	ax
 29967                                  	push	bx
 29968                                  	call	fm_link
 29969                                  	pop	bx
 29970                                  	pop	ax
 29971                                  	retn
 29972                                  
 29973                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29974                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 29975                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29976                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 29977                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 29978                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 29979                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29980                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 29981                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29982                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 29983                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0.  That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 29984                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 29985                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 29986                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29987                                  
 29988                                  loadLow:
 29989                                  	;push	ds
 29990                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 29991                                  	;pop	ds	
 29992                                  
 29993                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 29994                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 29995                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 29996                                  	jne	short ll10
 29997                                  
 29998                                  	stc
 29999                                  ll15:
 30000                                  	mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 30001                                  	;stc
 30002                                  	;jmp	short llX
 30003                                  	retn
 30004                                  ll10:	
 30005                                  	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 30006                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 30007                                  
 30008                                  	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30009                                  	retn
 30010                                  
 30011                                  	;mov	al,1
 30012                                  	;clc
 30013                                  ;llX:
 30014                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 30015                                  	;retn
 30016                                  
 30017                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30018                                  ;*** HideUMBs - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 30019                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30020                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30021                                  ; EXIT:   None
 30022                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30023                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 30024                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30025                                  
 30026                                  HideUMBs:
 30027                                  	push	ax
 30028                                  	push	cx
 30029                                  	push	ds
 30030                                  	push	es
 30031                                  
 30032                                  	call	UmbTest		; See if we REALLY linked in anything...
 30033                                  	jc	short husX	; ...if not, there's nothing for us to do.
 30034                                  
 30035                                  	call	FixMem		; Concatenate adjacent free MCBs in upper mem
 30036                                  	call	setUMBs		; Link UMBs and set memory-allocation strategy
 30037                                  
 30038                                  	;putdata fInHigh,1	; Remember that we're now running high
 30039                                  	mov	byte [cs:fInHigh],1
 30040                                  
 30041                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; See if they gave us a list to leave free
 30042                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30043                                  
 30044                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED	; If they didn't,
 30045                                  	je	short husX	; then we shouldn't do this loop:
 30046                                  
 30047                                  	xor	cx,cx
 30048                                  
 30049                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 30050                                  ; HUS10-CX - UMB number (after inc, 1==first UMB)
 30051                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 30052                                  
 30053                                  hus10:	inc	cx		; For each UMB:
 30054                                  	cmp	cx,MAXUMB ; 16
 30055                                  	jae	short hus20
 30056                                  
 30057                                  	mov	al,cl		; (stopping as soon as we're outside of the
 30058                                  	push	es
 30059                                  	call	findUMB		; valid range of UMBs)
 30060                                  	pop	es		; push/pop: trash what findumb finds.  :-)
 30061                                  	jc	short hus20
 30062                                  
 30063                                  	call	_hideUMB_	; hide what we need to hide.
 30064                                  
 30065                                  	jmp	short hus10
 30066                                  hus20:	
 30067                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; Now check if they offered /L:0
 30068                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 30069                                  
 30070                                  	or	al,al		; --Is the load UMB 0? (-1==unspecified)
 30071                                  	jnz	short husX	; If not, we're done.
 30072                                  
 30073                                  	call	hl_unlink	; If so, however, fix UMBs and strategy.
 30074                                  husX:	
 30075                                  	pop	es
 30076                                  	pop	ds
 30077                                  	pop	cx
 30078                                  	pop	ax
 30079                                  	retn
 30080                                  
 30081                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30082                                  ;*** GetLoadUMB - Returns the load UMB number in AL (-1 if not specified)
 30083                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30084                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30085                                  ; EXIT:   AL == load UMB
 30086                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30087                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30088                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30089                                  
 30090                                  ;GetLoadUMB:
 30091                                  ;	;getdata al, UmbLoad
 30092                                  ;	push	ds
 30093                                  ;	push	cs
 30094                                  ;	pop	ds
 30095                                  ;	mov	al,[UmLoad]
 30096                                  ;	pop	ds
 30097                                  ;	retn
 30098                                  
 30099                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30100                                  ;*** GetLoadSize - Returns the load UMB minimum size (0 if not specified)
 30101                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30102                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30103                                  ; EXIT:   AX == load UMB minimum size
 30104                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30105                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30106                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30107                                  
 30108                                  GetLoadSize:
 30109                                  	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30110                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 30111                                  	jmp	short GetSize
 30112                                  
 30113                                  	;push	bx
 30114                                  	;;push	si
 30115                                  	;push	ds
 30116                                  	;push	cs
 30117                                  	;pop	ds
 30118                                  
 30119                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 30120                                  
 30121                                  	;xor	ah,ah			;    ax==UMB
 30122                                  	;mov	bx,UmbSize		;    bx==array
 30123                                  	;shl	al,1	                ;    ax==offset
 30124                                  	;;add	ax,bx			;    ax==element index
 30125                                  	;;mov	si,ax			; ds:si==element index
 30126                                  
 30127                                  	;;lodsw				;    ax==size
 30128                                  
 30129                                  	;add	bx,ax
 30130                                  	;mov	ax,[bx]
 30131                                  
 30132                                  	;pop	ds
 30133                                  	;;pop	si
 30134                                  	;pop	bx
 30135                                  	;retn
 30136                                  
 30137                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30138                                  ;*** GetSize - Returns the UMB in AL's minimum size (0 if not specified)
 30139                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30140                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == a UMB number
 30141                                  ; EXIT:   AX == UMB minimum size, as specified by the user
 30142                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30143                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30144                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30145                                  
 30146                                  GetSize:
 30147                                  	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30148                                  
 30149                                  	push	bx
 30150                                  	;push	si
 30151                                  	;push	ds
 30152                                  	;push	cs
 30153                                  	;pop	ds
 30154                                  
 30155                                  	xor	ah,ah			;    ax==UMB
 30156                                  	mov	bx,UmbSize		;    bx==array
 30157                                  	shl	al,1	                ;    ax==offset
 30158                                  	;add	ax,bx			;    ax==element index
 30159                                  	;mov	si,ax			; ds:si==element index
 30160                                  
 30161                                  	;lodsw				;    ax==size
 30162                                  
 30163                                  	add	bx,ax
 30164                                  	;mov	ax,[bx]
 30165                                  	mov	ax,[cs:bx]
 30166                                  
 30167                                  	;pop	ds
 30168                                  	;pop	si
 30169                                  	pop	bx
 30170                                  	retn
 30171                                  
 30172                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30173                                  ;*** StoLoadUMB - Overrides the load UMB number with what's in AL
 30174                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30175                                  ; ENTRY:   AL == new load UMB
 30176                                  ; EXIT:    None
 30177                                  ; ERROR:   None
 30178                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX
 30179                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30180                                  ; CAUTION: Should only be used if /L:... was used.  Logically, that is the only
 30181                                  ;          time you would ever need this, so that's okay.
 30182                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30183                                  
 30184                                  ;StoLoadUMB:
 30185                                  ;	;putdata UmbLoad, al
 30186                                  ;	push	es
 30187                                  ;	push	cs
 30188                                  ;	pop	es
 30189                                  ;	mov	[es:UmbLoad],al
 30190                                  ;	pop	es
 30191                                  ;	retn
 30192                                  
 30193                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30194                                  ;*** StoLoadSize - Overrides the load UMB minimum size with what's in AX
 30195                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30196                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == new load size
 30197                                  ; EXIT:   None
 30198                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30199                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30200                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30201                                  
 30202                                  StoLoadSize:
 30203                                  	push	dx
 30204                                  
 30205                                  	;getdata dl, UmbLoad		; Put UMB# in DL and size in AX
 30206                                  	;
 30207                                  	;push	ds
 30208                                  	;push	cs
 30209                                  	;pop	ds
 30210                                  	;mov	dl,[UmbLoad]
 30211                                  	;pop	ds	
 30212                                  
 30213                                  	mov	dl,[cs:UmbLoad]
 30214                                  
 30215                                  	cmp	dl,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30216                                  	je	short sls10
 30217                                  
 30218                                  	call	stowSiz			; We've got a function to do just this
 30219                                  sls10:	
 30220                                  	pop	dx
 30221                                  	retn
 30222                                  
 30223                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30224                                  ;*** hideUMB - marks as HIDDEN all FREE elements in UMB passed as AL
 30225                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30226                                  ; ENTRY:    AL must indicate a valid UMB; 0==conv && is invalid.
 30227                                  ; EXIT:     None; free elements in UMB marked as hidden
 30228                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30229                                  ; USES:     Flags
 30230                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30231                                  
 30232                                  hideUMB:
 30233                                  	push	ax
 30234                                  	push	es
 30235                                  
 30236                                  	call	findUMB		; Returns with carry if err, else ES == MCB
 30237                                  	jc	short huX
 30238                                  
 30239                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30240                                  ; HU10--ES - MCB inside UMB; if it's a system MCB,
 30241                                  ;            we're not in the same UMB, so exit.
 30242                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30243                                  
 30244                                  hu10:	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 30245                                  	jz	short huX	; If it is, we've finished the UMB.
 30246                                  	;call	isFreeMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 30247                                  	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 30248                                  	jnz	short hu20
 30249                                  
 30250                                  	call	hideMCB
 30251                                  hu20:	
 30252                                  	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 30253                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ;'Z'
 30254                                  	jz	short huX	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 30255                                  
 30256                                  	;NextMCB es, ax		; Go on forward.
 30257                                  	mov     ax,es
 30258                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 30259                                  	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30260                                  	inc     ax
 30261                                  	mov     es,ax
 30262                                  
 30263                                  	jmp	short hu10
 30264                                  huX:	
 30265                                  	pop	es
 30266                                  	pop	ax
 30267                                  	retn
 30268                                  
 30269                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30270                                  ;*** isTiny - returns with ZF set if user didn't specify /S
 30271                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30272                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30273                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if user DIDN'T specify /S
 30274                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30275                                  ; USES:     Flags
 30276                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30277                                  
 30278                                  isTiny:
 30279                                  	push	ax
 30280                                  
 30281                                  	;getdata al, fUmbTiny
 30282                                  	;
 30283                                  	;push	ds
 30284                                  	;push	cs
 30285                                  	;pop	ds
 30286                                  	;mov	al,[fUmbTiny]
 30287                                  	;pop	ds
 30288                                  
 30289                                  	mov	al,[cs:fUmbTiny]		
 30290                                  
 30291                                  	or	al,al
 30292                                  	pop	ax
 30293                                  	retn
 30294                                  
 30295                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30296                                  ;*** isFreeMCB - returns with ZF set if current MCB (ES:0) is FREE
 30297                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30298                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 30299                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if MCB is free, else !ZF
 30300                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30301                                  ; USES:     Flags
 30302                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30303                                  
 30304                                  ;isFreeMCB:
 30305                                  ;	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 30306                                  ;	retn
 30307                                  
 30308                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30309                                  ;*** hideMCB - marks as HIDDEN the MCB at ES:0
 30310                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30311                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 30312                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB marked as HIDDEN
 30313                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30314                                  ; USES:     None
 30315                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30316                                  
 30317                                  hideMCB:
 30318                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8
 30319                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME+0], 'HI' ; 4948h
 30320                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME+2], 'DD' ; 4444h
 30321                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME+4], 'EN' ; 4E45h
 30322                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME+6], '  ' ; 2020h	
 30323                                  	retn
 30324                                  
 30325                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30326                                  ;*** unHideMCB - marks as FREE the MCB at ES:0
 30327                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30328                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 30329                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB marked as FREE
 30330                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30331                                  ; USES:     None
 30332                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30333                                  
 30334                                  unHideMCB:
 30335                                  	push	ax
 30336                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],FreePSPOwner ; 0
 30337                                  	mov	ax,'  ' ; 2020h
 30338                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+0],ax
 30339                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+2],ax
 30340                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+4],ax
 30341                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+6],ax
 30342                                  	pop	ax
 30343                                  	retn
 30344                                  
 30345                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30346                                  ;*** findUMB - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 30347                                  ;            -- returns UmbHEAD pointer (0x9FFF) if passed AL==0
 30348                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30349                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 30350                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to first MCB in UMB (_not_ the 8+SC MCB that heads it)
 30351                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (too high)
 30352                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 30353                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30354                                  
 30355                                  findUMB:
 30356                                  	push	ax
 30357                                  	push	cx
 30358                                  	push	dx
 30359                                  
 30360                                  	xor	ah,ah		; Zap ah, so al==ax
 30361                                  
 30362                                  	mov	dx,ax		; Store the to-be-found UMB number in DX
 30363                                  
 30364                                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns first UMB segment in AX
 30365                                  	mov	es,ax
 30366                                  	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now...
 30367                                  
 30368                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 30369                                  ; FU10--CX - This UMB number; 0 == conventional
 30370                                  ;       DX - The UMB number they're looking for
 30371                                  ;       ES - The current MCB address
 30372                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 30373                                  
 30374                                  fu10:	
 30375                                  	cmp	cx,dx		; If CX==DX, we've found the UMB we're
 30376                                  	je	short fuX	; searching for--so exit.
 30377                                  
 30378                                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 30379                                  	jnz	short fu20
 30380                                  
 30381                                  	inc	cx		; If it _was_ SYSTEM, we're in a new UMB.
 30382                                  fu20:	
 30383                                  	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 30384                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 30385                                  	je	short fuE	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 30386                                  
 30387                                  	;NextMCB es, ax		; Go on forward.
 30388                                  	mov     ax,es
 30389                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 30390                                  	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30391                                  	inc     ax
 30392                                  	mov     es,ax
 30393                                  
 30394                                  	jmp	short fu10
 30395                                  fuE:	
 30396                                  	stc
 30397                                  fuX:
 30398                                  	pop	dx
 30399                                  	pop	cx
 30400                                  	pop	ax		; The address is already in ES.
 30401                                  	retn
 30402                                  
 30403                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30404                                  ;*** BigFree - makes ES:0 point to the largest free MCB in UMB given as AL
 30405                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30406                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 30407                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to largest free MCB in UMB, AX returns its size
 30408                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (0 or too high)
 30409                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 30410                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30411                                  
 30412                                  BigFree:
 30413                                  	push	bx
 30414                                  	push	cx
 30415                                  
 30416                                  	call	findUMB			; Returns with CF if err, else ES==MCB
 30417                                  	jc	short bfX		; (would be "jc bfE"; it just does stc)
 30418                                  
 30419                                  	xor	bx,bx			; Segment address of largest free MCB
 30420                                  	xor	cx,cx			; Size of largest free MCB
 30421
